titleEN: Analysis of data architecture, processes and roles of a selected enterprise
titleCZ: Analıza datové architektury, procesù a rolí vybraného podniku
KeywordsEN: data governance; architecture; SME
KeywordsCZ: SME; data governance; architektura
AbstractEN: The presented bachelor thesis focuses on a detailed analysis of data architecture, processes, and roles in a selected small or medium-sized enterprise. The aim is to identify key areas for improving the efficiency and competitiveness of the enterprise. This thesis will provide the enterprise with a set of suggestions for improvement. The proposals will focus on data governance, modern data architecture, new roles, and processes. The research methods include a literature search and a semi-structured interview with a selected data professional operating in the selected company. Based on the analysis of the status, specific improvements and measures will be proposed. These suggestions will then be validated with experts and practitioners in the field to verify their relevance and feasibility.

titleEN: E-shop for selling custom artwork
titleCZ: E-shop pro prodej umìlecké tvorby na zakázku
KeywordsEN: e-shop; web application; HTML; CSS; JavaScript; PHP; SQL
KeywordsCZ: webová aplikace; HTML; CSS; Internetovı obchod; JavaScript; PHP; SQL
AbstractEN: The thesis is centred around designing and implementing an e-shop which sells custom made paintings. Along with that the site will serve as an online presentation for the artist Bc. Kateøina Beránková, whose art pieces are displayed there. For the development I used the MMSP methodology, thanks to which I was able to customize the app based on the specifications provided by the artist herself on our regular meetings. To ensure the best estimate on the importance of each element I decided to analyse other already existing online presentations of other local and foreign artists and e-shops which specialize in custom made products. From the research I gathered that each artist presentation offers a about me page and a gallery with their previous work. E-shops specialized in custom made products have alongside the order form a series of links that forward the user on various legal texts, such as terms and conditions and privacy policies. The main result of this thesis is a fully functional author’s website for Bc. Kateøina Beránková, where the visitor can learn more about her life, view her previous work and submit a custom order, the details of which they can communicate with the artist herself.

titleEN: Fake news and manipulation on social networks
titleCZ: Fake news a manipulace na sociálních sítích
KeywordsEN: fake news; social networks; manipulation; information; disinformation
KeywordsCZ: fake news; sociální sítì; manipulace; informace; dezinformace
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis focuses on the topic of fake news and manipulation on social networks. The aim of this thesis is to conduct original research focused on the ability to identify fake news on social networks among young people from Prague and compare it with the results of research on the ability to identify fake news among young people from Moscow by authors Zuykina and Sokolova, which was published in the journal of Tomsk State University. The theoretical part of the thesis describes the concepts of information, disinformation, fake news and social networks, presents the results of research conducted by the authors of the Moscow State University M. V. Lomonosov. To achieve the set goal, the following methods are used in the methodology: research, questionnaire survey, and comparison. The practical part consists of the set goal and hypotheses. The empirical research was conducted in the form of a questionnaire survey. The collected data were further evaluated and used in the development of the already set goal.

titleEN: Migrating on-premise web application to the cloud
titleCZ: Migrace on-premise webové aplikace do cloudu
KeywordsEN: prototype development ; system design architecture; IoT; cloud migration
KeywordsCZ: IoT; návrh systémového designu; migrace do cloudu; vıvoj prototypu
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis primarily focuses on designing a system architecture for migrating a web application to cloud environment. The key objective is to create a robust and scalable architecture that efficiently supports the collection, aggregation, and visualization of data, while addressing specific challenges associated with cloud infrastructure. The thesis examines existing on-premises solutions, identifies key areas for improvement, and proposes a new solution utilizing modern cloud technologies and principles. Additionally, the thesis includes the development and evaluation of a prototype, demonstrating the practical applicability and efficiency of the proposed system design.

titleEN: Mobile application for monitoring and improving sleep habits
titleCZ: Mobilní aplikace pro sledování a zlepšení spánkovıch návykù
KeywordsEN: mobile application; Android; sleep; persuasive design; Jetpack Compose
KeywordsCZ: persvazivní design; mobilní aplikace; Android; Jetpack Compose; spánek
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis presents the process and results of the development of Schleep, a mobile application aimed at monitoring and improving users&apos; sleep habits. To motivate the user effectively, the app uses persuasive design principles. It focuses on the principle of competition by gamifying the adherence to a regular sleep schedule.  The paper commences by establishing a comprehensive theoretical framework to provide a nuanced understanding of the subject matter. An analysis of existing solutions is conducted, paving the way for the subsequent design of the application. Within this design phase, the author meticulously outlines all requirements that the resulting software must fulfill. It then describes the process of implementing the application using the modern Jetpack Compose framework and the Material Design 3 design system. The fulfilment of the design requirements was verified by acceptance testing and user feedback was obtained using a standardized Post-Study System Usability Questionnaire (PSSUQ).  The primary deliverables of this bachelor thesis include the public release of the source code and the Schleep mobile application itself.

AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the design and implementation of a web application for a client that provides massage services. The main goal is to create a modern informational and booking system that allows clients to easily access information about services and book massages online. The work is guided by the waterfall model of software development, providing a structured framework for progressive planning, development, testing, and maintenance of the project. Emphasis is placed on simplicity, clarity, and an attractive design for users. Modern technologies such as Next.js, Typescript, Tailwind CSS, and Prisma are used for efficiency and quality of the resulting product. The outcome is a functional web application that supports the client&apos;s business and enhances communication with her customers.

titleEN: Evaluation of agent SARSA in the algorithmic IQ test
titleCZ: Vyhodnocení agenta SARSA v testu algoritmického IQ
KeywordsEN: Universal intelligence; Reinforcement learning; Artificial intelligence; Algorithmic Intelligence Quotient Test; SARSA; aluating Intelligence of AI Systems
KeywordsCZ: vyhodnocování inteligence systémù UI; Univerzální inteligence; umìlá inteligence; posilované uèení; test algoritmického IQ; SARSA
AbstractEN: Evaluating the intelligence of artificial agents has long taken an anthropocentric route, such as the Turing test, but it is not without problems. Its binary nature is not ideal for comparing very similar systems where exact metrics are needed. Such a metric is offered by the AIQ test, which is the main point of this thesis.  This bachelor thesis is concerned with the analysis of the performance of reinforcement learning agents, specifically the SARSA and SARSA(<U+03BB>) algorithms, and their subsequent evaluation using the AIQ test, which serves as a practical approximation to the theory of universal intelligence.  The thesis has a theoretical section that introduces the two main topics by synthesizing key literature. The most important sources for the topic of evaluating artificial systems are Legg & Veness (2013) and Vadinsky&apos;s dissertation (2018b). For reinforcement learning, Sutton & Barto (2014) was the main source for the synthesis, describing each element of reinforcement learning in depth. Putting the topic in context is necessary to understand the work as a whole. I discuss the practical part of the thesis at the end of chapter two, where I describe how I implemented the agents, which I further elaborate in chapter three. The last chapter is devoted to the practical experiments, where I ask the research questions and analyze the results.  •How does SARSA and its SARSA(<U+03BB>) extension perform relative to other agents tested in the AIQ?  •How does SARSA and its extension SARSA(<U+03BB>) perform specifically against Q-learning agents?  •What is the effect of each parameter on the results?  The experimental results show an interesting phenomenon that would be worth investigating more in the future, that the SARSA and SARSA(<U+03BB>) agents perform at different levels, with the SARSA(<U+03BB>) agent performing slightly worse than the baseline version of SARSA. Apart from the phenomenon mentioned above, the agent behaved as expected and the performance was weaker than the Q-learning agent. It is because of the assumed behaviour that occurred that we could strengthen the argument for the validity of the AIQ test. The analysis of the effect of parameters revealed that parameter values can significantly affect the performance of agents especially at the extremes at the specified interval. The paper concludes by presenting the results and outlining avenues for possible follow-up research on this issue.

Takovou metriku nabízí AIQ test, kterı je stìejním bodem této práce.  Bakaláøská práce se zabıvá analızou vıkonnosti agentù posilovaného uèení, konkrétnì algoritmù SARSA a SARSA(<U+03BB>), a jejich následnou evaluací pomocí AIQ testu, kterı slouí jako praktická aproximace teorie univerzální inteligence. Práce má teoretickou èást, která uvádí do obou stìejních témat syntézou klíèové literatury. Pro posilované uèení byla pøi syntéze hlavním zdrojem kniha Sutton & Barto (2014), která popisuje kadı prvek posilovaného uèení do hloubky. Uvedení do kontextu tématiky je nutné pro pochopení práce jako celku.  Praktické èásti práce se vìnuji v závìru druhé kapitoly, kde popisuji, jak jsem implementoval agenty, co dále rozvádím ve tøetí kapitole. Poslední kapitola se vìnuje praktickım experimentùm, kde si kladu vızkumné otázky a analyzuji vısledky.  •Jak si vede SARSA a její rozšíøení SARSA(<U+03BB>) vùèi dalším agentùm otestovanım v AIQ testu?  •Jak si vede SARSA a její rozšíøení SARSA(<U+03BB>) konkrétnì vùèi agentùm Q-learningu? •Jakı je vliv jednotlivıch parametrù na vısledky?   Vısledky experimentù ukazují zajímavı fenomén, kterı by stálo za to více provìøit do budoucna. A to, e agenti SARSA a SARSA(<U+03BB>) dosahují rozdílnıch úrovní vıkonnosti, pøièem agent SARSA(<U+03BB>) vykazuje o nìco horší vısledky ne základní verze SARSA. Mimo zmínìného fenoménu se agent choval podle pøedpokladu a vıkon byl slabší ne u agenta Q-learningu. Právì díky pøedpokládanému chování, které nastalo, mùeme posílit argument pro validitu AIQ testu. Analıza vlivu parametrù odhalila, e hodnoty parametrù mohou vıraznì ovlivnit vıkonnost agentù hlavnì v extrémních hodnotách u stanoveného intervalu. Závìrem práce jsou prezentovány vısledky a pøedstaveny zpùsoby moného navazujícího vızkumu této problematiky.

titleEN: Use of freely available projects for building an integrated smart home
titleCZ: Vyuití volnì dostupnıch projektù pro sestavení integrované chytré domácnosti

AbstractEN: This thesis introduces and analyzes the smart home market and related technologies in  detail. It describes the different ways of smart home integration and their advantages and  disadvantages. It also determines which environments each type of setup is best suited to  and compares their approximate costs on a defined household model. The last chapter of  the thesis discusses the process of installing a smart home using open source software. The  aim of the thesis is to design and develop a user-friendly control system that enables  efficient control, automation and management of smart devices in the home.

titleEN: Web interfaces for working with large language models
titleCZ: Webová rozhraní pro práci s velkımi jazykovımi modely
KeywordsEN: Large language models; infrastructure; web technologies; API; inference
KeywordsCZ: webové technologie; API; infrastruktura; Velké jazykové modely; inference
AbstractEN: This bachelor’s thesis focuses on free tools for deploying large language models (LLMs) on local hardware. The theoretical section surveys related technologies and presents the foundational theory necessary for creating an understanding of the area. Three main directions were identified: application development, model development, and infrastructure technologies. Relevant publicly available software projects are briefly introduced to provide an overview. In the practical section, selected tools were deployed using the Llama 3 model and their basic functionalities were demonstrated. Additionally, a demonstrative web application was implemented to validate statements with a given internet source. The application is based on an existing validation script which was adapted for the purpose of this paper. The application integrates the deployed LLM tools, illustrating concepts that can be encountered in applications using LLMs. The university’s local infrastructure was utilized. Finally, a brief qualitative comparison of the deployed technologies was conducted, and their most suitable use case was identified.

V teoretické èásti je proveden prùzkum souvisejících technologií a je pøedstaven teoretickı základ pro pochopení problematiky. Byly identifikovány tøi hlavní smìry. Tìmi jsou vıvoj aplikací, tvorba modelù, a infrastrukturní technologie. Re- levantní veøejnì dostupné softwarové projekty byly struènì pøedstaveny za úèelem vytvoøení pøehledu. Následnì bylo provedeno struèné srovnání zprovoznìnıch technologií z kvalitativního hlediska a bylo urèeno jejich nejvhodnìjší vyuití.

titleEN: Web interface for association rule mining using low-code frameworks
titleCZ: Webové rozhraní pro dolování asociaèních pravidel pomocí low-code frameworkù
KeywordsEN: machine learning; Association rules; Python; user interface; web application
KeywordsCZ: Python; uivatelské rozhraní; webová aplikace; Asociaèní pravidla; strojové úèení
AbstractEN: This work focuses on creation of web interface for association rule mining. The interface was designed and programmed in a low-code framework Anvil and offers the user to pass custom values of interestingness measures. The input file contains thousands of rows representing customers of a fictional bank with their loan payments. Association rules can thus be used to search for patterns of customer behavior in the dataset, for example to detect which of the groups repay their loans and which do not. The dataset is being processed on the server side represented by Jupyter Notebook by association rules mining methods, which have been proven by countless experts and researchers. These methods communicate directly with the user interface of the web application, where the result of the calculation is then displayed to the user. The web application was being continuously tested and some interesting association rules can be discovered in the user-friendly interface once the advanced options for entering parameters are taken advantage of.

Rozhraní bylo navreno a naprogramováno v low-code frameworku Anvil a nabízí uivateli zadání vlastních hodnot mìøítek zajímavosti. Vstupní dataset obsahuje nìkolik tisíc øádkù záznamù v podobì zákazníkù fiktivní banky s údaji o splácení úvìrù. Asociaèními pravidly tak lze v datasetu hledat vzory chování zákazníkù napøíklad pro zjištìní, které jejich skupiny úvìry splácí a které ne. Dataset je zpracován funkcemi na serveru v Jupyter notebooku. Tyto funkce obsahují vızkumníky i odborníky z praxe ovìøené algoritmy pro dolování a sestavení asociaèních pravidel podle zadanıch parametrù a komunikují s uivatelskım rozhraním webové aplikace, kde je následnì zobrazen vısledek vıpoètù uivateli. Aplikace byla prùbìnì testována a v pøehledném uivatelském rozhraní se pomocí pokroèilıch moností zadávání parametrù dají objevit nìkterá zajímavá asociaèní pravidla.

Externí analıza se zamìøuje na postavení spoleènosti na trhu a aktuální trní podmínky. Tato èást je zastøešena SWOT analızou, která identifikovala silné a slabé stránky, pøíleitosti a hrozby spoleènosti. Na základì tìchto analız byly v souladu s poadavku od vedení firmy definovány klíèové ukazatele vıkonnosti (KPI). Poté byly definovány jednotlivé dimenze, které tvoøí základ dimenzionálního modelu. Tento model byl poté pouit k vytvoøení samotného BI øešení. DESIGN CLUB s.r.o. ohodnotil vısledky práce jako kvalitní a uiteèné, a má zájem zaøadit toto øešení jako souèást svıch pracovních procesù za úèelem zefektivnìní vıkonu
AbstractCZ: This bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the company analysis of DESIGN CLUB s.r.o. and the subsequent creation of a Business Intelligence (BI) solution for the company. The main objective of the thesis is to provide the company with tools that will streamline its operations, improve data handling, and support decision-making processes. DESIGN CLUB s.r.o. specializes in the sale of bathroom and interior components and design. The company&apos;s main operations primarily cover the Czech and Slovak markets, with occasional sales to other Central European countries. To achieve the intended results, this bachelor’s thesis comprises of several key steps. The first, theoretical part of the thesis analyzes the company from both internal and external perspectives. The internal analysis includes mapping and assessing the company’s structure, activities, information system, and the state of its business processes. The external analysis focuses on the company&apos;s market position and subsequently market conditions as a whole. This part is concluded with a SWOT analysis, which identifies the strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats of the company. Subsequently, the company was analyzed from a BI perspective, which included an analysis of the company’s BI requirements and relevant BI factors. Based on these analyses and in line with the management&apos;s requirements, key performance indicators (KPIs) were defined. Then, individual dimensions forming the basis of the dimensional model were defined. This model was then used to create the BI solution. Completing these steps led to the development of a finished BI application that provides reports and dashboards displaying processed analytical data outputs of the company. DESIGN CLUB s.r.o. evaluated the results as high-quality and useful and is interested in incorporating this solution into its business processes to improve efficiency

AbstractEN: The smart home is an emerging trend of the last decade. With the increasing number of smart home devices comes the challenge of designing controls for intuitive control all products in one place.   This paper deals with the definition and detailed description of the smart home concept. It also focuses on the analysis of several key technologies that are currently used to control smart homes including Home Assistant, Apple HomeKit, Google Home, Amazon Alexa and Samsung SmartThings.  The main objective of the work was to design a new user interface that is consistent, visually appealing and intuitive to use. Figma was used to design the individual elements. Testing of the entire prototype was conducted and the designs were compared with existing technologies that were presented in the theoretical part of the thesis. The overall results were very positive, the author&apos;s design ranked second in the comparison of the individual components of the controls in terms of visual appeal and ease of use. In the user testing of the controls, most respondents expressed their preference for the author&apos;s design in terms of consistency, clarity and attractiveness.

titleEN: Analysis, Detection and Prevention of Cyber Threats in Machine Learning Environments
titleCZ: Analıza, Detekce a Prevence Kybernetickıch Hrozeb v Prostøedí Strojového Uèení
KeywordsEN: machine learning; deep learning; detection; cyber threats; security risks; prevention
KeywordsCZ: machine learning; deep learning; bezpeènostní rizika; kybernetické hrozby; prevence; detekce
AbstractEN: The bachelor&apos;s thesis stems from the growing need to address security threats in the environment of Machine Learning (ML) and Deep Learning (DL) models, focusing on the identification and prevention of cyber threats that could impact the reliability and credibility of these models. The aim of the thesis is to systematically analyze security risks, weaknesses, and threats, and propose methods for their detection and prevention, using an experimental ML model predicting diabetes, which is tested for the effectiveness of three selected cyber attacks. The results of the experimental research demonstrate the real impacts of these attacks on the model. Subsequently, potential weak points are identified based on the results, and protection, detection, and prevention methods against attacks on ML models are proposed. Ethical and legal aspects of these attacks are also considered. This thesis highlights the importance of researching the security of ML and DL models, providing a comprehensive overview of potential threats and their impacts. Thus, it contributes to a better understanding of security risks in the field of ML and DL and helps develop more effective strategies for protecting these models in practice.
AbstractCZ: Bakaláøské práce vychází z rostoucí potøeby øešit bezpeènostní hrozby v prostøedí Machine Learning (ML) a Deep learning (DL) modelù a zamìøuje se na identifikaci a prevenci kybernetickıch hrozeb, které mohou ovlivnit spolehlivost a dùvìryhodnost tìchto modelù. Cílem práce je s pomocí experimentálního ML modelu predikující diabetes, na kterém je testována úèinnost tøí vybranıch kybernetickıch útokù, systematicky analyzovat a identifikovat bezpeènostní rizika, slabá místa a hrozby a navrhnout metody pro jejich detekci a prevenci. titleEN: Application portfolio of a small company through the lens of the TIME model

AbstractEN: The aim of the bachelor thesis is to evaluate the state of the application portfolio in a small company that provides electrical installation services using the TIME model. The third chapter is devoted to the company&apos;s application portfolio itself, i.e. the application of the established methodology for data collection, processing into the TIME model and finally presentation, interpretation and evaluation of the data. titleEN: Ethical evaluation of legal privacy protection through the GDPR and the e-Privacy Directive
titleCZ: Etické zhodnocení právní ochrany soukromí pomocí GDPR a smìrnice e-privacy
KeywordsEN: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR); e-Privacy Directive; ethics; personal data; privacy; profiling
KeywordsCZ: etika; osobní údaje; profilování; Obecné naøízení o ochranì osobních údajù (GDPR); smìrnice e-Privacy; soukromí
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis is devoted to an ethical evaluation of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the e-Privacy Directive. The thesis is structured into theoretical and practical parts. The theoretical part deals with the issue of personal data, with an emphasis on the risks and threats associated with the careless handling of private data. After a legal analysis of the two legislative texts, an ethical assessment was made based on the ideas of Helen Nissenbaum and Daniel J. Solove. Furthermore, the thesis highlights the importance of the role of the individual himself as a data subject, to whom the responsibility of protecting and selecting the personal data to be shared is often delegated. While both the GDPR and the e-Privacy Directive provide an effective protection framework for data subjects, it is the human factor that is the key. It is therefore important that such an individual is both adequately informed and educated in the area, so that they can effectively counter potential threats.  The practical part focuses on exploring awareness and ethical attitudes towards GDPR and the e-Privacy Directive among ordinary internet users. The results show a certain paradox between the perceived importance of privacy protection and actual behaviour, with users often agreeing to the processing of their data without reading the terms and conditions. The results further suggest that although the GDPR as a whole is perceived to be in line with ethical principles, its profiling sub-part is not perceived as such. Furthermore, the research provides important information to confirm some of the conclusions of the ethical evaluation and offers insights into how users understand and evaluate these regulations from an ethical perspective.   In the ethical assessment, the author concludes that although both regulations are not fully ethical in the area of transparency of the presentation of the conditions of processing of personal data, it would be difficult to find a legal solution that would not restrict the freedoms of either of the parties involved. It was also found that not everything can be legally regulated for various reasons, some situations have to be communicated between people. The author correctly estimated that the most common way of not reading the terms and conditions of personal data processing among the respondents is the length and time it takes to read them.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce se vìnuje etickému zhodnocení Obecného naøízení o ochranì osobních údajù (GDPR) a smìrnice e-Privacy. Práce je strukturována na teoretickou a praktickou èást. Teoretická èást se zabıvá problematikou osobních údajù, s dùrazem na rizika a hrozby spojené s neopatrnou manipulací s privátními daty. Po právní analıze obou legislativních textù bylo provedeno etické zhodnocení na základì myšlenek Helen Nissenbaum a Daniela J. Solove. Dále práce zdùrazòuje vıznam role samotného jedince jako datového subjektu, na kterého je èasto pøenesena zodpovìdnost ochrany a vıbìru osobních dat, která budou sdílena. Naøízení GDPR i smìrnice e-Privacy sice pøedstavují efektivní rámec ochrany pro datové subjekty, klíèovım je však právì i lidskı faktor. Je proto dùleité, aby byl takovı jedinec v dané oblasti adekvátnì informován i vzdìlán, a dokázal tak efektivnì èelit potenciálním hrozbám.  Praktická èást se soustøedí na zkoumání povìdomí a etickıch postojù ke smìrnici e-Privacy a naøízení GDPR mezi bìnımi uivateli internetu. Vısledky ukazují urèitı paradox mezi vnímáním dùleitosti ochrany soukromí a skuteènım chováním, kdy uivatelé èasto souhlasí se zpracováním svıch údajù bez pøeètení podmínek. Z vısledkù dále vyplıvá, e aèkoliv je naøízení GDPR jako celek vnímáno v souladu s etickımi principy, jeho dílèí èást v podobì profilování tak vnímána není. Vızkum dále poskytuje dùleité informace pro potvrzení nìkterıch závìrù etického hodnocení a nabízí pøehled o tom, jak uivatelé rozumí tìmto regulacím z etického pohledu a jak je hodnotí.  V rámci etického zhodnocení autorka došla k závìru, e aèkoliv obì naøízení v oblasti transparentnosti prezentování podmínek zpracování osobních údajù nejsou plnì etická, jen obtínì by se hledalo právní øešení, které by neomezilo svobody ani jedné ze zainteresovanıch stran. Dále bylo zjištìno, e ne vše lze z rùznıch dùvodù právnì regulovat, nìkteré situace musí bıt vykomunikovány mezi lidmi navzájem. Autorka správnì odhadla, e nejbìnìjším zpùsobem neètení podmínek zpracování osobních údajù mezi respondenty je jejich délka a èasová nároènost na ètení.

titleEN: Employee evaluation, acceptance and perception of the impact of artificial intelligence
titleCZ: Hodnocení umìlé inteligence zamìstnanci, její pøijímání a vnímání dopadù
KeywordsEN: artificial intelligence; ethics; technology adoption; social impact; work environment
KeywordsCZ: umìlá inteligence; etika; pøijímání technologií; spoleèenskı dopad; pracovní prostøedí
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the research of ethical aspects related to the use of artificial intelligence (AI) in the workplace. The main objective of this thesis is to analyse the perspectives of employees on AI, researching their acceptance of this technology and understanding their perception of impacts on the work environment. Thesis focuses on issues of trust, transparency, and fairness in the context of the deployment of AI in the work environment. The results of the empirical research show that most employees do not feel apprehensive about the introduction of AI in the workplace and would rather embrace this innovation in their work process. The results of this study will contribute to a better understanding of the ethical challenges associated with AI and provide recommendations for promoting the ethical use and deployment of AI in the work environment.

titleEN: Implementation and testing of cloud computing in the Microsoft Azure environment
titleCZ: Implementácia a testovanie cloud computingu v prostredí Microsoft Azure

KeywordsCZ: bezpeènos; riadenie prístupu; testovanie; správa identít; cloud computing; Microsoft Azure
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis focuses on cloud computing and its implementation and testing on the Microsoft Azure platform. The introductory section introduces the topic and its objectives, which include gaining a basic understanding of cloud computing and demonstrating the importance of identity and access management features. The theoretical part of the thesis provides a comprehensive overview of the fundamentals of cloud computing, deployment models, and services offered. This provides the necessary theoretical foundation for understanding practical implementation and testing in the subsequent section. The practical part describes the methodology for practical research, including the configuration of identity and access management features. Subsequently, these features are tested, and the security of accounts with and without these features is compared. The conclusion summarizes the results of the theoretical and practical parts of the thesis and discusses their implications and recommendations for improving implementation and further research based on the knowledge gained.
AbstractCZ: Bakalárska práca sa zaoberá cloud computingom a jeho implementáciou a testovaním na platforme Azure od spoloènosti Microsoft. titleEN: Cyberattacks on ML/DL Models

KeywordsCZ: Kybernetická bezpeènost; Modely strojového uèení (ML); Hluboké uèení (DL); Útoky na modely ML a DL; Bezpeènostní opatøení; Kybernetické hrozby
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on cyber threats in the field of machine learning (ML) and deep learning (DL) models. It analyses different types of attacks that can compromise the integrity, availability and confidentiality of these models. The theoretical part provides a comprehensive view of the basic principles of ML and DL and explains their vulnerabilities in cyber environments. The practical part of the thesis focuses on simulating selected attacks in a sandbox environment and on the Gandalf v.2 test model, examining the impact of the attacks and techniques to strengthen the security of ML and DL models. The aim is to provide useful insights for cybersecurity practitioners and ML/DL application developers.

AbstractEN: This thesis explores the capabilities, applications, and impact of Generative Pre-trained Transformer (GPT) models, with a particular emphasis on their potential within software development. It begins with a theoretical foundation, examining the evolution of GPT models and the transformer architecture that underpins their ability to generate human-quality text. A comparative analysis highlights the distinctions and ongoing advancements among various GPT iterations and similar architectures. The thesis also delves into the wide-ranging applications of GPT models, along with a discussion of the ethical considerations and societal impacts they raise. To demonstrate the practical utility of GPT models, this thesis details a case study in which a GPT model is integrated into a software development workflow. The project&apos;s implementation, execution, and results are evaluated, offering insights into potential benefits and future use cases. The &quot;Concept Explorer&quot; application is presented as an example, showcasing the application of GPT models for concept explanation and translation. The thesis concludes with a synthesis of theoretical concepts and practical findings, emphasizing key takeaways and suggesting potential areas for future research into GPT models&apos; role in software development.

titleEN: Open expression in digital communication between the bank and its clients

AbstractEN: The aim of this bachelor thesis is to investigate the state of open expression in digital communication between banks and their clients and highlights the risks associated with the lack of personal contact and its impact on the level of openness of expression in digital communication. Due to the rapid development of information technology and the digitalization of banking services, changes are occurring in the way banks and clients interact, which has a significant impact on the quality and availability of banking services. The analysis is conducted through observation methods, document analysis and internet communication on social networks, supplemented by a questionnaire survey. The findings show through specific cases that although risks of loss of open expression exist, at the moment digital technologies do not limit open expression between the bank and its clients. The paper also makes recommendations for improving digital communication practices so that the same state of open expression can be maintained in the future, to better respond to clients&apos; needs and preferences while maintaining a high level of personalisation and the client&apos;s sense of involvement in the process.

titleEN: Level of awareness of GDPR and its causes among the Czech public
titleCZ: Úroveò povìdomí èeské veøejnosti o GDPR a jeho pøíèiny
KeywordsEN: data protection awareness; personal data; GDPR impact; digital protection; GDPR
KeywordsCZ: GDPR; osobní údaje; povìdomí o ochranì údajù; impakt GDPR; digitální ochrana
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis examines the level of public awareness of GDPR in the Czech Republic and identifies the key factors that influence this level of awareness. The thesis presents a detailed analysis of the GDPR, including its main principles and policies, and explores their application in the digital age. Through a questionnaire survey, the thesis examines the current awareness of the GDPR among the Czech public and compares the data with research that has been conducted in the past, at the level of the entire European Union. The results show that although awareness of the GDPR is at a reasonable level in the Czech Republic, a deeper understanding of the specific rights and obligations is still lacking, which can have serious consequences for both individuals and organizations. The work also revealed the lack of awareness campaigns and the complexity of legal texts as major barriers to a better understanding of the GDPR. The paper concludes with recommendations for improving public awareness of the topic, which should lead to better data protection and increased legal certainty for all stakeholders.

titleEN: The impact of misinformation and fake news in cyberspace on public health during health crises
titleCZ: Vliv dezinformací a fake news v kyberprostoru na veøejné zdraví bìhem zdravotních krizí
KeywordsEN: disinformation; fake news; cyberspace; public health; health crisis; psychological factors; sociodemographic factors; Covid-19; Ebola
KeywordsCZ: fake news; kyberprostor; veøejné zdraví; dezinformace; zdravotní krize; psychologické faktory; sociodemografické faktory; Covid-19; Ebola
AbstractEN: The presented bachelor thesis deals with the issue of misinformation and fake news in cyberspace and their impact on public health during health crises. In an era of online environments&apos; increasing importance and involvement in our daily lives, misinformation poses a significant threat. This paper provides a detailed look at selected factors that make cyberspace a suitable environment for the spread of misinformation, such as anonymity, speed and reach, echo chambers and filter bubbles, algorithm manipulation, and complex misinformation campaigns, including an analysis of selected psychological factors that involve corrective sense-making, intuitive thinking, cognitive failures, social and affective factors, health anxiety, pre-existing misinformation beliefs and repeated exposure, and last but not least, an analysis of socio-demographic factors affecting trust in misinformation such as education, income, age, political orientation and geographic location. Furthermore, it examined the impact of misinformation during two specific health crises, the Ebola epidemic in African countries and the global Covid-19 pandemic. In the practical part, a questionnaire survey was conducted to identify the riskiest behavioural patterns in questions representing psychological factors and the most used media for information acquisition. The questionnaire survey found that respondents showed the riskiest behaviours in the question, representing repeated exposure and the most frequent use of internet sources for obtaining information. The main methodological approaches include qualitative analysis, comparative methods, and questionnaire surveys.

Dále zkoumala dopady dezinformací bìhem dvou specifickıch zdravotních krizí, epidemie Ebola v africkıch zemích a celosvìtové pandemie Covid-19. titleEN: Usage of generative artificial intelligence in marketing

KeywordsEN: marketing; artificial intelligence; generative artificial intelligence
KeywordsCZ: generativní umìlá inteligence; umìlá inteligence; marketing
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis explores the potential of generative artificial intelligence (GAI) in marketing, focusing on its ability to generate content for marketing campaigns. The main objective is to evaluate GAI&apos;s ability to produce marketing content that is comparable to the creations of marketing/design professionals while having the potential to effectively engage a wide audience. The theoretical part defines artificial intelligence and discusses in detail the concept of GAI and its applications in marketing. The practical part uses quantitative research to evaluate the ability of GAI to produce marketing content through a questionnaire survey and analysis of the generated results. The final section summarizes the findings and presents recommendations for the effective use of GAI in marketing strategies. The research findings show that generative artificial intelligence has the ability to produce visually appealing content that can compete and often surpass human creativity. This ability can be very effective in creating various advertising campaigns. However, research also shows that even though GAI already can produce visually compelling images, there are still subtle clues that distinguish their origin from human creations and thus negatively impact potential customers&apos; perception of the attractiveness of advertising.

AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis explores the integration of artificial intelligence into web application development, specifically using OpenAI&apos;s ChatGPT language model. The work provides an overview of AI applications in modern software engineering, identifies main challenges, and addresses practical implementations. The practical section focuses on developing a web application for generating and storing strong passwords, where ChatGPT serves as a tool for automation, optimization, and technical support. The findings demonstrate that integrating ChatGPT can significantly enhance development processes, though it requires careful oversight and consideration of security aspects. The thesis also discusses the ethical and security dimensions of using AI in software development and suggests directions for future research.

titleEN: Analysis of Metrics and Factors of Virality of a YouTube Channel
titleCZ: Analıza metrík a faktorov virality YouTube kanálu
KeywordsEN: YouTube Analytic; YouTube; video; sentiment analysis; social networks
KeywordsCZ: sociálne siete; YouTube Analytics; YouTube; video; analıza sentimentu
AbstractEN: The aim of this thesis is to analyse the metrics and factors influencing the virality of YouTube videos, specifically using data from the author&apos;s own YouTube channel. The theoretical part provides a comprehensive overview of the YouTube platform, its recommendation algorithm, and the key performance metrics used to evaluate video success. It also delves into sentiment analysis techniques and their applicability in the context of YouTube. The analytical part employs both descriptive and inferential statistical methods, including correlation analysis and regression models, to uncover the key predictors of video performance. The results indicate that while video length and posting frequency significantly impact video views, title sentiment has a negligible influence on engagement metrics like click-through rates and audience retention. The presence of paid sponsorships was found to positively affect engagement rates, suggesting that well-integrated sponsorships can enhance viewer interaction. Furthermore, multiple regression models revealed that video length and frequency of posting videos are significant predictors of video views. The practical recommendations for YouTube content creators emphasize the importance of a balanced content strategy that combines consistency, video length optimization, effective audience engagement and content quality. These insights can help content creators enhance their video performance and also contribute to the broader understanding of YouTube&apos;s algorithm and social media analytics.

Tieto poznatky môu tvorcom obsahu pomôc zvıši úspešnos ich videí a tie prispie k širšiemu pochopeniu odporúèacieho algoritmu platformy YouTube a analytiky sociálnych sietí.

titleEN: Social media analysis of state institutions
titleCZ: Analıza sociálních sítí státních institucí
KeywordsEN: public authorities; Social networks; public institutions; analysis; efficiency; communication
KeywordsCZ: veøejné instituce; sociální sítì; státní orgány; analıza; efektivita; komunikace
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis analyses the social networks of public institutions in the Czech Republic with an emphasis on the efficiency of the use of financial resources. The aim was to find out how different state institutions manage their social networks, what financial resources they spend on this activity and also to create a comparison between these institutions. The method involved the collection of qualitative and quantitative data, including a questionnaire survey and analysis of social networks of selected institutions. The work revealed that all institutions manage their social networks themselves, indicating a desire for self-control. The costs of social networks vary considerably across institutions and the study showed that some entities are unable to quantify these costs. This points to potential weaknesses in monitoring and evaluation of the resources invested. The paper concludes that further research is needed to gain a deeper understanding, which should focus on further data collection and specific aspects of communication across public sector institutions. This study contributes to the understanding of the use of social media in and highlights the importance of effective use of these platforms for transparency and communication with the public.

KeywordsEN: Optimization; Inventory management; Café environment; Python; JavaScript
KeywordsCZ: Optimalizace; Øízení zásob; Python; JavaScript; Gastronomické prostøedí
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis presents a detailed introduction to the issue of inventory management optimization with an emphasis on a specific application in the catering industry. The main purpose of this thesis is not only through the theoretical part but also through practical application to create a comprehensive guide and a tool for effective inventory management, especially in the specific environment of cafes and restaurants. This tool is a web application that will be used to optimize inventory management.  The Python programming language combined with JavaScript was used to develop the web application. Real data from operations, specifically inventory data and product consumption or product demand data in the catering business in question, was used to guarantee the practicality of the application and to test its functionality. Thanks to this realistic base, it was possible not only to investigate the issue theoretically but also to practically verify the functioning of the proposed procedures and algorithms.  The key phase of the work was the calculation of the necessary data and then the calculation of the optimal order. This optimal order was then compared with the real order made in the given period by the. This comparative process allowed to evaluate the effectiveness of the web application.  Another crucial part of the proccess was testing the developed application directly in the environment of a café. The application was presented to the owner of the café for which it was specially designed. Her opinion was positive except for a few critiques, for example the absence of user accounts. The introduction of the application led to a significant speeding up of the whole ordering process and at the same time to a significant reduction of costs associated with inefficient inventory management.  Overall, it can be concluded that the thesis has not only made a theoretical contribution in the field of inventory management optimization but its output has also practical use in a real business environment. Thus, the application has the potential to become a useful tool for managers and owners of catering businesses who are looking for effective ways to optimize their inventories and reduce operating costs.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce pøedstavuje podrobné pøedstavení problematiky optimalizace øízení zásob s dùrazem na konkrétní aplikaci v gastronomickém odvìtví. Tato optimální objednávka byla následnì porovnána s reálnou objednávkou provedenou v daném období v konkrétním gastronomickém provozu, kterı data poskytl. Tento srovnávací proces následnì umonil zhodnotit funkènost celé webové aplikace.  Další dùleitou èástí práce bylo testování vytvoøené aplikace pøímo v prostøedí gastronomického podniku. Celkovì lze tedy konstatovat, e byla nejen teoretickım pøínosem v oblasti optimalizace øízení zásob, ale její vıstup v podobì webové aplikace má i praktické vyuití v reálném podnikatelském prostøedí. titleEN: Automation of DWH development
titleCZ: Automatizace developmentu DWH
KeywordsEN: automation; data warehouse; PostgreSQL; dbt
KeywordsCZ: automatizace; datovı sklad; dbt; PostgreSQL
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the automation of DWH development. The main objective of the thesis is to implement a solution for automating DWH development. The thesis is divided into two main parts: a theoretical introduction and practical application. In the theoretical part, a detailed overview of basic concepts and current literature related to DWH automation is provided. Key technologies and methodologies are defined, including an explanation of the principles of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) and ELT (Extract, Load, Transform), which are fundamental for working with data in data warehouses. The practical part focuses on the design and implementation of solutions to enhance the efficiency of data warehouse development. Two approaches are described: the use of pgSQL as a traditional DWH development technology and dbt for advanced automation functions. Both methods are then compared in terms of efficiency, speed, and reduction of potential errors in the development process. The outcome of the thesis provides a clear comparison of the benefits of using the dbt tool for data warehouse automation, based on a comparison with the traditional development approach. Overall, this work presents a comprehensive view of DWH development automation using the latest technologies.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce se vìnuje automatizaci developmentu DWH. Hlavním cílem práce je implementace øešení pro automatizaci developmentu DWH. V teoretické èásti je poskytnut podrobnı pøehled základních pojmu a souèasné literatury tıkající se automatizace v DWH. Obì metody jsou následnì porovnány z hlediska efektivity, rychlosti a sníení monosti chyb v procesu developmentu. Vısledkem práce je poskytnutí jasného srovnání pøínosù pøi vyuití nástroje dbt pro automatizaci datového skladu, a to na základì srovnání s tradièním pøístupem vıvoje. Celkovì tato práce pøináší ucelenı pohled na automatizaci vıvoje DWH s vyuitím nejnovìjších technologií.

titleEN: Flask application for creating quizzes
titleCZ: Flask aplikace pro tvorbu kvízù
KeywordsEN: user interface in the Czech language; Flask; Shibboleth; Socket.IO; web application; quiz application; open-source
KeywordsCZ: Shibboleth; Socket.IO; uivatelské rozhraní v èeském jazyce; kvízová aplikace; webová aplikace; open source; Flask
AbstractEN: This thesis addresses the problem of the lack of scientific research in the field of web-based quiz applications. This has resulted in a poorly mapped current state of available solutions on the market and an unclear position between service providers and users. The thesis highlights the relevance of this problem and explores its possible implications.  In response to this issue, the thesis implements an open-source web quiz application with a Czech user interface, a base product that aims to become an open-source alternative to commercial solutions. First, a literature review is conducted to identify the technologies used in the implementations of key products. Then, existing open-source solutions with user interfaces in the Czech language are identified. The introductory chapters provide an insight into the theoretical basis of the technologies used. Special attention is paid to the principle of web applications, the Python microframework Flask, together with the templating engine Jinja2, Single Sign-On, and its implementation Shibboleth. The practical part of the thesis documents the definition of requirements, database model design and integration of Flask, Socket.IO and Shibboleth technologies. The process of deploying the application using Apache and Gunicorn is also described. At the end of the practical part, the service is tested using end-to-end tests.  The outcome of the thesis is a functional open-source web quiz application with a user interface in the Czech language, together with an implementation documentation describing the individual steps, together with the application process and the interconnection of the technologies used.
AbstractCZ: Práce reaguje na problém nedostateèného vìdeckého prùzkumu v oblasti webovıch kvízovıch aplikací. Dùsledkem je špatnì zmapovanı souèasnı stav dostupnıch øešení na trhu, spolu s nejasnou pozicí mezi poskytovateli slueb a uivateli. titleEN: Flask app for creating quizzes -  extension of backend functionality
titleCZ: Flask aplikácia pre tvorbu kvízov -  rozšírenie funkcionality backendu
KeywordsEN: Flask; quiz; backend; web application; functionality extension
KeywordsCZ: webová aplikácia; kvíz; rozšírenie funkcionalít; backend; Flask
AbstractEN: This thesis is about extending the functionalities in a quiz application created in Flask. The main goal of the work is to extend the current functionalities of the quiz application with new ones, namely the ability to create true/false questions, create public quizzes, sort quizzes, create open-ended questions and export quiz results. In order to fulfil the main goal, sub-tasks were also set in this thesis, namely to perform and analysis of the current application and to understand the potential of Flask in web application development. In the beginning, an analysis of the application without added functionalities is done. In the analysis is described current state and the architecture of application. The analysis includes client and server-side analysis, database preview and testing of current functionalities. To do this analysis, the documentation review method was used. After the analysis a theoretical insight into the new functionalities is provided. In the theoretical insight are explained the benefits for the application and users. The theoretical preview also includes individual screens of the application with the implemented functionality. The largest part of the thesis is the implementation of the new functionalities. The implementation contains individual code listings, with changes to them. Along with the code listing, there is always an explanation of them, and what had to be modified in the code so that the new functionalities were successfully implemented.  At the end, the implemented functionalities are tested using test scenarios. The scenarios also contain examples of screens to give the reader a view of where a given step of the test takes place. The output of the work is a quiz application in Flask with extended functionalities.
AbstractCZ: Táto práca sa zaoberá rozšírením funkcionalít v kvízovej aplikácii vytvorenej v Flasku. titleEN: Generative artificial intelligence in visual content creation
titleCZ: Generativní umìlá inteligence vizuálního obsahu
KeywordsEN: Generative artificial intelligence; Artificial intelligence; Prompt engineering; DALL·E; Midjourney
KeywordsCZ: Generativní umìlá inteligence; Umìlá inteligence; Prompt engineering; DALL·E; Midjourney
AbstractEN: The aim of this bachelor thesis is to provide a comprehensive overview of existing methods and techniques of artificial intelligence that enable the generation of visual documents, with an emphasis on the DALL·E and Midjourney models. The theoretical part introduces the general structure and principles of operation of generative models, their training process and mechanisms that allow generating new visual content based on user instructions.   The practical part of the work focuses on experimental testing and comparison of the performance of selected models in visual content generation. Not only the quality and relevance of the generated images in relation to the prompts will be examined, but also the effectiveness and limitations of individual systems. Prompt engineering, the process of optimizing user instructions to achieve the best results, is introduced as a key skill for effectively utilizing generative AI models. The results and findings can serve as a guide for future research, development, and applications of generative AI in various fields, especially marketing.
AbstractCZ: Cílem práce je poskytnout ucelenı pøehled o stávajících metodách a technikách umìlé inteligence, které umoòují generování obrazovıch dokumentù, a to s dùrazem na modely DALL·E a Midjourney. V teoretické èásti je pøedstavena obecná struktura a principy fungování generativních modelù, jejich trénování a mechanismy, díky kterım je moné generovat novı vizuální obsah na základì uivatelskıch pokynù.  Praktická èást práce se vìnuje experimentálnímu testování a porovnání vıkonu vybranıch modelù v rámci generování vizuálního obsahu. Zkoumána je nejen kvalita a relevantnost vygenerovanıch obrazù vùèi zadání (promptùm), ale i efektivita a limitace jednotlivıch systémù. Prompt engineering, proces optimalizace uivatelskıch pokynù pro získání co nejlepších vısledkù, je pøedstaven jako klíèová dovednost pro efektivní vyuívání generativních AI modelù. Vısledky a zjištìní mohou slouit jako vodítko pro budoucí vızkum, vıvoj a aplikace generativní AI v rùznıch oblastech, zejména pak marketing.

titleEN: Implementation of data quality indicators in a banking institution
titleCZ: Implementace indikátorù datové kvality v bankovní instituci
KeywordsEN: Data Governance; Data Quality; Data Steward; Data Quality Indicators
KeywordsCZ: Data Quality; Data Steward; datová kvalita; Data Governance; indikátory datové kvality
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis examines the problem of implementing Data Quality Indicators (DQI) in the context of a banking institution. DQI is a metric for measuring DQ. To better understand DQIs, the study discusses the topics of Data Governance (DG) and Data Quality (DQ) in the theoretical part. In addition to the theoretical part, the bachelor thesis includes a practical part in which the predetermined objectives are fulfilled. The main objective of the presented bachelor thesis is analysis and DQI in a banking institution in order to automate the process of error analysis and correction. Automation will improve the efficiency of the work as it will save manual work in error analysis and correction. The sub-objectives of the thesis are to analyze the current state of DQI and to illustrate the process of implementing DQI in a banking institution. The action research method is used to achieve the set objectives and solve the problem. The results of the thesis include a table of implemented DQIs, illustration and explanation of the process of DQI implementation in a banking institution, and a proposal for a new DQI documentation solution, which is right now user-unfriendly.
AbstractCZ: Pøedkládaná bakaláøská práce (dále jen BP) zkoumá problém implementace indikátorù datové kvality (Data Quality Indicators dále jen DQI) v kontextu bankovní instituce. DQI je metrika pro mìøení datové kvality (dále jen DQ). K lepšímu pochopení DQI BP pojednává v teoretické èásti o tématech Data Governance (správa dat – dále jen DG) a DQ. Kromì teoretické èásti je souèástí BP praktická èást, ve které se naplòují pøedem urèené cíle. Hlavním cílem BP je analıza DQI v bankovní instituci za úèelem zautomatizování procesu analızy chyb a jejich oprava. Vısledky BP zahrnují tabulku implementovanıch DQI, znázornìní a vysvìtlení procesu implementace DQI v bankovní instituci a návrh nového øešení DQI dokumentace, která je aktuálnì uivatelsky nepøívìtivá.

titleEN: Human Recognition of Outputs from Generative Artificial Intelligence in Visual Arts
titleCZ: Lidské rozpoznání vıstupù generativní umìlé inteligence ve vıtvarném umìní
KeywordsEN: artificial intelligence; fine arts; generated images; generative artificial intelligence; recognition of generated images
KeywordsCZ: generativní umìlá inteligence; generované obrazy; rozpoznání vygenerovanıch obrazù; umìlá inteligence; vıtvarné umìní
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis focuses on the topic of artificial intelligence and generative artificial intelligence. The main objective of the bachelor thesis is to determine through an experiment how well humans are able to distinguish images generated by artificial intelligence from original works and to identify factors that influence this ability. The sub-objectives of the thesis are to introduce artificial intelligence and its principles, generative artificial intelligence and the tools it uses to generate images. In the theoretical part, a literature review is carried out. As part of the empirical research, a questionnaire survey is conducted in which the respondents indicate whether an image is generated or original and express on a scale how confident they are in their answer. The data obtained from the experiment is further statistically examined. The examination reveals that factors such as gender, age, education, display size, work in a technical field, experience with artificial intelligence and knowledge of art did not affect the ability to distinguish between generated and original images. When the results were weighted by the confidence value, it appears that respondents from technical fields and those with previous experience with AI made better use of the confidence scale, i.e., choosing a high number on the scale for the correct answer. Knowledge of art also has an effect: respondents with none to limited knowledge of art are less confident in their correct answers. Overall, respondents are more likely to correctly identify original works, while AI-generated works are more likely to be mistaken for original.
AbstractCZ: Pøedkládaná bakaláøská práce se zabıvá tématem umìlé inteligence a generativní umìlé inteligence. Hlavním cílem bakaláøské práce je prostøednictvím experimentu zjistit, jak dobøe jsou lidé schopni rozeznat obrazy vygenerované umìlou inteligencí od originálních dìl a identifikovat faktory, které tuto schopnost ovlivòují. Dílèí cíle práce jsou seznámit s umìlou inteligencí a jejími principy, generativní umìlou inteligencí a nástroji, kterımi generuje obrazy. V teoretické èásti je provedena rešerše literatury. V èásti empirického vızkumu probíhá dotazníkové šetøení, ve kterém respondenti odpovídají, zda je obraz generovanı nebo originál, a na škále vyjádøí, jak moc si jsou jisti svou odpovìdí. Data získaná z experimentu jsou dále statisticky zkoumána. Šetøení odhaluje, e faktory jako pohlaví, vìk, vzdìlání, velikost displeje, pùsobení v technickém oboru, zkušenosti s umìlou inteligencí a znalost umìní neovlivnily schopnost rozlišovat mezi generovanımi a originálními obrazy. Pøi hodnocení vısledkù váenıch hodnotou jistoty se ukazuje, e respondenti z technickıch oborù a ti s pøedchozí zkušeností s umìlou inteligencí lépe vyuívali škálu jistoty. Tedy u správné odpovìdi volí vysoké èíslo na škále. Také znalost umìní má vliv: respondenti s ádnımi a omezenımi znalostmi umìní si jsou ménì jistí ve svıch správnıch odpovìdích. Celkovì respondenti èastìji správnì identifikují originální díla, zatímco díla generovaná umìlou inteligencí jsou èastìji mylnì povaována za originální.

titleEN: Implementace Matrix serveru
titleCZ: Matrix server implementation
KeywordsEN: home-server,; open-source; Docker; Synapse; Matrix; federace
KeywordsCZ: open-source; federation; Synapse; Docker; Matrix; home-server
AbstractEN: Tato práce se zabıvá pøedevším open-source standardem Matrix, kterı byl vyvinut v roce 2014 a zpopularizován koncem druhé poloviny desetiletí, veden pøedevším nadací The Matrix.org Foundation a od ní odštìpenou ziskovou slokou Element. Cílem je nastavit a nakonfigurovat funkèní instanci Synapse, jednoho z nejpopulárnìjších serverù postavenıch na tomto standardu.  Na zaèátku je pøedstaven protokol Matrix se struènım popisem jeho historie a klíèovıch pojmù potøebnıch k pochopení jeho funkcionality. Poté je uveden obecnı pøehled souèasného stavu vıvoje nìkolika serverù a klientù na nìm zaloenıch a také nìkterá pouití protokolu pozoruhodná buï svım rozsahem, nebo organizací, která za nimi stojí.  Dále je zde shrnuta historická a souèasná konkurence spojená s touto oblastí.  Nakonec je uveden podrobnı popis samotné implementace Synapse, zpracovanı tak, aby se jej mohl pøípadnı ètenáø øídit jako jedním z pøíkladù pro své vlastní projekty. Obsahuje také nìkolik základních statistickıch údajù o vıkonu a poadavcích serveru a pøípadná budoucí zlepšení.
AbstractCZ: This work is primarily concerned with the open-source standard Matrix, developed in 2014 and popularised in the late 2010s, headed mainly by The Matrix.org Foundation as well as their for-profit cousin Element. The goal is to set up and configure a working instance of Synapse, one of the most popular servers built on the standard.  Initially, the Matrix protocol is introduced with a basic description of its history and fundamental concepts needed to understand its function. Then, there is a general overview of the current state of development of several matrix servers and clients, as well as some uses of the protocol notable for either their scale or the organisation behind them. Next comes the summary of the historical and current competition associated with the field.  Finally, there is a detailed description of the Synapse implementation itself, meant for a reader to potentially be able to follow it as an example for their own projects. This also includes basic statistics about the server&apos;s performance, requirements, and possible future improvements.

titleEN: Optimization of monitoring and analysis of warehouse operations at ILICO Europe s.r.o. through the online tools Make.com and Metabase
titleCZ: Optimalizace monitoringu a analızy skladovıch operací v ILICO Europe s.r.o. prostøednictvím online nástroje Make.com a Metabase
KeywordsEN: IT; no-code; Metabase; system; Make; Business; Intelligence
KeywordsCZ: no-code; informaèní; Intelligence; Business; systémy; Metabase; Make
AbstractEN: This work aims to create a system that enables monitoring of warehouse movements in the distribution company ILICO, followed by the development of specific no-code scenarios and solutions for Business Intelligence. These solutions will be used by the company owner and the Business Development team to support decision-making regarding the purchase and sale of goods. To achieve the defined goal, close collaboration with the company owner was necessary, allowing access to the company&apos;s information system and data needed for the analysis and design of the application itself. The work is structured into theoretical and practical parts. In the theoretical part, basic characteristics of No-code and Business Intelligence are introduced to readers, from which specific application solutions arise. The practical part is divided into an analysis of the company&apos;s environment, the design of monitoring scenario solutions using the online platform Make, the design of a BI system, and a report showing the current state of the warehouse using the online platform Metabase. The main contribution of this work is the real deployment of the application in the company as support for decision-making and subsequent improvement of the company&apos;s management. Another contribution is the possibility of deploying this solution in other structurally similar companies.

titleEN: Optimization of inventory management system of a gastronomic business using a web application
titleCZ: Optimalizace zásobovacího systému gastronomického podniku pomocí webové aplikace
KeywordsEN: inventory management; web application; Amazon EC2; IMS; (Q, R) inventory model; Java Spring Boot; ReactJs
KeywordsCZ: Java Spring Boot; ReactJs; Amazon EC2; webová aplikace; IMS; øízení zásob; (Q, R) model øízení zásob
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the development of a web application aimed at optimizing the inventory management system of a gastronomic business. The resulting application will serve as an inventory management system and will include the implementation of an inventory control model. This model will enable users to calculate the optimal order size for specific goods and determine their reorder points. The theoretical part of the thesis introduces inventory management, describes inventory control models with both deterministic and stochastic demand, and explains the concepts of IMS, POS, and cloud computing. The empirical part involves applying the   inventory control model to real data and detailing the development of the web application. This includes analysing business processes, specifying requirements, designing the application architecture, and constructing the data model. The application will be hosted on a web server provided by the Amazon EC2 cloud service and will be accessible via a web browser. The primary technologies used for the web application are Java Spring Boot for the backend and ReactJs for the frontend.

titleEN: Comparison of AI Art Generators
titleCZ: Porovnání UI nástrojù pro generování vıtvarného umìní
KeywordsEN: tool comparison; Craiyon; text-to-image; Deep Dream Generator; artificial intelligence; generative artificial intelligence; Leonardo.Ai; NightCafe Creator; AI Art Generators
KeywordsCZ: UI nástroje pro generování vıtvarného umìní; Craiyon; Deep Dream Generator; Leonardo.Ai; NightCafe Creator; umìlá inteligence; generativní umìlá inteligence; text-to-image; porovnání nástrojù
AbstractEN: The submitted bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the comparison of four AI Art Generators, which also represents its main objective. The sub-goals include an introduction to the topic of artificial intelligence and generative artificial intelligence in art and familiarization with AI Art Generators. The bachelor&apos;s thesis is divided into theoretical and practical part. The theoretical part is designed to achieve the sub-objectives, which it accomplishes through a review of available sources. The practical part, which serves to fulfil the main objective, is divided into basic (theoretical) and practical comparison. The tools which were chosen by the author for the comparison include Craiyon, Deep Dream Generator, Leonardo.Ai and NightCafe Creator. The comparison uses the method of multi-criteria evaluation of alternatives. In the basic and practical comparison, the tools are described according to established criteria and evaluated on the basis of Likert scale ranging from 1 to 5 points. Weights are assigned to all criteria using the pairwise comparison method with the application of Fuller&apos;s triangle. The output of the practical part consists of tables with the final scoring of the tools and the determination of their ranking from both parts of the comparison, followed by a cumulative overall ranking. From the basic comparison, the Leonardo.Ai tool performs the best. In the practical comparison, Deep Dream Generator is in first place. In the overall comparison, Leonardo.Ai is in first place again.
AbstractCZ: Pøedkládaná bakaláøská práce se zabıvá porovnáním ètyø UI nástrojù pro generování vıtvarného umìní, jen rovnì pøedstavuje její hlavní cíl. Nástroje vybrané autorkou pro porovnání zahrnují Craiyon, Deep Dream Generator, Leonardo.Ai a NightCafe Creator. K porovnání je pouita metoda vícekriteriálního hodnocení variant. V základním i praktickém porovnání jsou nástroje popsány dle stanovenıch kritérií a ohodnoceny na základì Likertovy škály v rozmezí od 1 do 5 bodù. titleEN: Social Impacts of Artificial Intelligence Development
titleCZ: Sociální dopady vıvoje umìlé inteligence
KeywordsEN: social impact; risk; artificial intelligence; effect; opportunity; future; public opinion
KeywordsCZ: umìlá inteligence; vliv; budoucnost; postoj obyvatel; pøíleitost; riziko; sociální dopad
AbstractEN: Artificial intelligence (AI) refers to the creation of computer systems or machines that have the ability to exhibit intelligent behaviour, or behaviour that would be considered intelligent if it were exhibited by a human. Artificial intelligence focuses on areas such as learning, pattern recognition, decision making, natural language understanding, and other abilities that are associated with human intelligence. The present bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the analysis of the social impacts of the development of artificial intelligence through a literature search and the analysis of the attitudes of the population of the Czech Republic towards these impacts through a questionnaire survey based on this research.  The goals of the thesis are to define the field of artificial intelligence, to analyse the literature in order to reveal potential existential/social risks and their possible solutions, and to design, implement and evaluate a questionnaire for a survey of the attitudes of the Czech population towards the revealed threats of artificial intelligence. The methodology includes observation method, literature search method, questionnaire survey method and comparison method. The results indicate a not very high diversity of attitudes of the population towards the social impact of artificial intelligence. Overall, there is a high level of optimism and belief in the positive impacts on different areas of human life, especially on health care, and the findings yielded a minimum of sceptical views from the respondents. This suggests that technological advances associated with AI are viewed positively and with hope for future benefits. New findings include recommendations for improving workforce education, data security, and collaboration between government, industry, and academia to minimize the negative impacts of AI and maximize its benefits to society.

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the analysis of the effectiveness of the use of social media of political subjects and their chairpeople in the political campaign period before the elections to the National Council of the Slovak Republic in 2023. The theoretical part of the thesis discusses the terms marketing, political marketing, web scraping, introduces social networks (Facebook, YouTube, Instagram, Twitter, TikTok) and puts them in the context of the parliamentary elections in Slovakia in 2023. From these data, which are suitably graphically represented, the conclusions (sum of engagement, comments, shares, keywords, communication style, for social media platforms from Meta cost of targeted advertising) are then evaluated in the Results section. The overall result of the work is an insight into the functioning and effectiveness of selected social networks in Slovak political marketing.

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis deals with the development of influencer marketing and its impact on consumer behavior. It examines how social media influences product sales and how this marketing strategy has evolved. The work analyzes academic literature and scientific articles, as well as specialized studies and research in this area.  The main objective of this thesis is to analyze the impact of influencer marketing on consumer behavior and to determine the extent to which influencers affect the real purchasing decisions of consumers. A secondary objective is to understand the historical development of influencer marketing, identify its key milestones, analyze its impact on current consumers (especially students), find out which types of influencer advertisements are most effective, and which products are most promoted and purchased by consumers through this form of marketing.

titleEN: Remote access to virtualised applications with high graphical requirements
titleCZ: Vzdálenı pøístup k virtualizovanım aplikacím s vysokımi grafickımi nároky

KeywordsCZ: vzdálená plocha; GPU virtualizace; hardwarová akcelerace; tenkı klient; virtualizace
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis discusses the possibilities of accessing virtualized applications with graphics, for which it is necessary to use HW acceleration of the graphics card. For the first part of the thesis, a literature search method was used to identify concepts related to GPU virtualization and remote desktop applications. Next, the specific software tools used in the practical part of the thesis were introduced. The second part describes the performed configuration of computer virtualization together with GPU virtualization. The first virtualization solution is based on the Proxmox VE platform together with an approach to GPU virtualization called as NVIDIA Virtual GPU. The second solution is Hyper-V together with GPU Partitioning virtualization. Subsequently, the functionality of the systems is verified using jobs that use the graphics card to detect potential problems and instability. Then the individual remote desktop solutions are tested. Using a comparison method, their offered functionality for this deployment scenario is assessed and their performance is compared.

Dále došlo k pøedstavení konkrétních softwarovıch nástrojù pouitıch v praktické èásti práce. Druhá èást popisuje provedenou konfiguraci virtualizace poèítaèù spoleènì s virtualizací GPU. První virtualizaèní øešení je postaveno na platformì Proxmox VE spoleènì s pøístupem k virtualizaci GPU nazvanım NVIDIA Virtual GPU. KeywordsEN: web application; reservation system; Python; Django; optimization
KeywordsCZ: webová aplikace; rezervaèní systém; Python; Django; optimalizace
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the design and implementation of a universal web-based reservation system. Its main goal is to create a web application that allows users to efficiently book various services and facilities, such as parking spaces or tennis courts. A secondary objective of the thesis is to optimize the allocation of reservations to specific locations based on one of the optimization goals chosen by the user. The main part of the thesis is dedicated to the implementation of the application, which is carried out using the Python programming language and the Django framework, with other technologies used in the development of the application including HTML, Javascript, AJAX, and the Bootstrap and PuLP libraries. The thesis also addresses the optimization functions used, both of which are formally described, implemented, and tested. The result of the thesis is a functional web application that provides a convenient interface for administrators and customers, including two optimization algorithms for better resource utilization.

Vedlejším cílem práce je pak optimalizace pøidìlení rezervací ke konkrétním místùm na základì jednoho z uivatelem zvolenıch optimalizaèních cílù. Hlavní èást práce je vìnována implementaci aplikace, která je realizována pomocí programovacího jazyka Python a frameworku Django, dalšími technologiemi pouitımi pøi tvorbì aplikace jsou HTML, Javascript, AJAX, knihovny Bootstrap a PuLP. titleEN: Design and implementation of an application to support tabletop role-playing game players
titleCZ: Zpùsoby ovlivòování uivatelù mobilních aplikací
KeywordsEN: Flabbergasted; TTRPG; role-playing games; PHP; web; web application
KeywordsCZ: Flabbergasted; TTRPG; webová aplikace; PHP; web; hry na hrdiny
AbstractEN: The thesis deals with the design and implementation of an application for the support of playing tabletop role-playing game, specifically focusing on the game Flabbergasted!, the creation of characters and clubs for this game, and the creation of notes. The main goal is to create a functional application that can be used by anyone who would like to play Flabbergasted!. The first part introduces the issues of role-playing games, the dominance of Dungeons and Dragons, and the issues of note-taking while playing longer campaigns. In the second part, the design for the app is created based on an analysis of the game and player needs, and then the creation and testing of said app is documented. The result of the work is a functional application, that people can use for playing.
