titleEN: Analysis and design of business intelligence for a construction company
titleCZ: Analıza a návrh Business Intelligence pro stavební  firmu
KeywordsEN: self service business intelligence; SSBI; construction company; construction industry; analysis
KeywordsCZ: self service business intelligence; SSBI; stavební firma; analıza; stavební prostøedí
AbstractEN: Analysis and design of business intelligence for a construction company is a bachelor thesis, which aims to create self service business intelligence (SSBI) for a construction company in Microsoft PowerBI. The construction firm in this thesis is a company that acts as a general contractor in the market. It is a medium sized firm with more than a decade of experience in the construction market. In order to create the SSBI, an analysis of the firm is created with an emphasis on describing the firm&apos;s processes. The firm&apos;s processes are described both verbally and using EPC digrams and relevant tables. The paper provides a view of the construction industry according to several indicators and trends that are already emerging in the construction industry and can be expected to grow in importance are described. A dimensional model is created in Microsoft PowerBI, focusing on the production department of a construction company and the management of construction project execution. This model allows the design of various indicators and charts, which are then integrated into more complex dashboards. These dashboards provide a faster overview and improve efficiency in the decision-making process.

Práce poskytuje pohled na stavební odvìtví podle nìkolika ukazatelù a jsou popsány trendy, které se ji ve stavebnictví objevují a lze oèekávat, e jejich dùleitost poroste. titleEN: Vıvoj programu pro optimalizaci portfolia cennıch papírù na ruském akciovém trhu
titleCZ: Development of a program for optimizing a securities portfolio on the Russian stock market
KeywordsEN: Efektivní Hranice; Markowitzùv model; Mean-Semivariance model; Mean-Variance model; Ruské akcie
KeywordsCZ: Mean-Semivariance model; Efficient Frontier; Markowitz model; Mean-Variance model; Russian stocks
AbstractEN: Efektivní správa portfolia je prvoøadá pro investory, kteøí se snaí dosáhnout optimálních vınosù pøi øízení rizik v dynamickém prostøedí ruského akciového trhu. Tato práce se zabıvá vıvojem Python programu  pro identifikaci optimálního portfolia ruskıch akcií pomocí dvou široce známıch modelù: Mean-Variance a Mean-Semivariance model.   Vızkum je rozdìlen do dvou hlavních èástí. V poèáteèní fázi se ponoøíme do moderní teorie portfolia, identifikujeme klíèové parametry a metodiky pro optimalizaci portfolia. To zahrnuje zkoumání kompromisù rizika a návratnosti, metriky hodnocení vıkonu a optimalizaèní techniky. Následnì se zamìøení pøesouvá na praktickou implementaci diskutovanıch teoretickıch konceptù. Nastíníme proces naèítání dat v reálném èase pomocí API a vyuití programování v Pythonu k formulování a øešení matematického modelu pro optimalizaci portfolia. Prostøednictvím empirické analızy a srovnávacích studií hodnotíme úèinnost vyvinutého Python programu pøi vytváøení optimalizovanıch portfolií pøizpùsobenıch ruskému akciovému trhu. V závìreèné èásti syntetizujeme zjištìní, zdùrazòujeme praktické dùsledky vızkumu a poskytujeme doporuèení pro investory, kteøí se snaí vyuít technologicky øízená øešení pro správu portfolia.
AbstractCZ: Effective portfolio management is paramount for investors seeking to achieve optimal returns while managing risks in the dynamic environment of the Russian stock market. This thesis addresses to develop a Python program for identifying the optimal portfolio of Russian stocks using two widely known models: Mean-Variance and Mean-Semivariance model.   The research is divided into two main parts. In the initial phase, we delve into the modern portfolio theory, identifying key parameters and methodologies for portfolio optimization. This includes an exploration of risk-return trade-offs, performance evaluation metrics, and optimization techniques. Subsequently, the focus shifts to the practical implementation of the theoretical concepts discussed. We outline the process of retrieving real-time data using API and leveraging Python programming to formulate and solve the mathematical model for portfolio optimization. Through empirical analysis and comparative studies, we evaluate the effectiveness of the developed Python program in constructing optimized portfolios tailored to the Russian stock market. In the concluding section, we synthesize the findings, highlight the practical implications of the research, and provide recommendations for investors seeking to leverage technology-driven solutions for portfolio management.

titleEN: E-SHOP FOR BUYING AND SELLING TEXTBOOKS IN LARAVEL
titleCZ: E-shop pro nákup a prodej uèebnic v Laravel
KeywordsEN: Laravel; purchase; PHP; sale; E-shop
KeywordsCZ: PHP; E-shop; Laravel; prodej; nákup
AbstractEN: This thesis aims to analyse the requirements of students for buying and selling textbooks and based on this analysis, to design and implement a pilot version of an e-commerce solution for buying and selling textbooks and other educational materials using the Laravel framework. The first part of the thesis will examine the functional requirements of students at the University of Economics in Prague and other potential users of the e-shop. Furthermore, existing solutions for the implementation of sales and purchases, technologies suitable for the implementation of e-commerce solutions, and the determination of their advantages and disadvantages will be analysed. Subsequently, an e-shop design will be created and finally an evaluation of the potential expansion of the e-shop to students at other universities in the Czech Republic and any risks associated with the implementation of the e-shop will be carried out. The second part will include the implementation of a pilot version according to the design from the theoretical part using the Laravel framework, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and database technologies. In conclusion, the output of the theoretical and practical parts will be evaluated, and it will be verified whether all the set goals and requirements have been met.

titleEN: Generative artificial intelligence for image synthesis
titleCZ: Generativní umìlá inteligence pro syntézu obrazu
KeywordsEN: disinformation; generative artificial intelligence; deepfakes; risks; image synthesis; copyright; diffusion models; artificial intelligence; machine learning; deep learning; security
KeywordsCZ: bezpeènost; dezinformace; hluboké uèení; deepfakes; umìlá inteligence; strojové uèení; generativní umìlá inteligence; difuzní modely; syntéza obrazu; autorská práva; rizika
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis is devoted to the identification and analysis of potential risks brought by generative artificial intelligence in the field of image synthesis. As part of the theoretical part, a literature review was carried out, on the basis of which the key terms associated with generative artificial intelligence and its components enabling image synthesis were defined. The work also presents possible risks and provides users with a basic methodology for their mitigation. In the practical part, quantitative research was carried out through a questionnaire survey with the aim of answering the research questions. A total of 183 respondents took part in the questionnaire and were also tested on their ability to distinguish synthetic images from real photographs. The research results showed that almost half of the respondents have personal experience with generative artificial intelligence for image synthesis and are aware of the risks associated with it. Respondents also confirmed that this technology is being misused for malicious purposes, including manipulation of public opinion. On average, research participants were able to identify approximately half of the synthetic images. In the future, the increasingly convincing outputs of generative artificial intelligence will represent a considerable challenge. Therefore, it is necessary to educate the general public and alert them to possible threats
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce je vìnována identifikaci a analıze potenciálních rizik, které pøináší generativní umìlá inteligence v oblasti syntézy obrazu. Úèastníci vızkumu byli schopni identifikovat v prùmìru pøiblinì polovinu syntetickıch obrázkù. V budoucnu budou stále pøesvìdèivìjší vıstupy generativní umìlé inteligence pøedstavovat znaènou vızvu. titleEN: IT Solution for the Support of Teraristics Based on the Internet of Things
titleCZ: IT øešení pro podporu teraristiky na bázi Internetu vìcí
KeywordsEN: thermometer; breeding; Homebridge; Internet of Things
KeywordsCZ: Homebridge; chov; Internet vìcí; teplomìr
AbstractEN: The Internet of Things is increasingly being used to connect the physical and digital worlds. This trend offers new perspectives and opportunities. The widespread use of modern technologies, commonly applied in everyday life, makes it increasingly accessible to new areas. For example, it is possible to use the Internet of Things to ensure the reproduction of natural conditions, which is a basic requirement for successful animal breeding. The specific requirements for the breeding of invertebrates, in particular beetles of the genus Goliathus, led the author to the decision to use information technology to monitor and ensure breeding conditions. The main objective of the work was to develop an IT solution to support invertebrate breeding. The sub-objectives of the thesis include a description of invertebrate breeding issues and requirements, formulation of the IT solution requirements and conceptual design of the solution, selection of the appropriate technology and HW and SW components to be used, determination of the methodology for the design and development of the IT solution for breeding support, development of the SW and HW solution and verification of the correct functionality and fulfilment of the requirements. Methods include literature and internet resources research, comparison of IoT definitions and analysis of breeding issues and fulfilment of requirements for breeding support. A multi-criteria decision-making method was used to select the elements. The system created based on selected solution is used by the author to monitor and ensure the conditions for breeding. The successful use of the Internet of Things in terraristics is a proof of the possibilities of its widespread use.

Specifické poadavky na chov bezobratlıch ivoèichù, zejména broukù rodu Goliathus, vedly autora k rozhodnutí vyuít informaèní technologie pro monitorování a zajištìní podmínek chovu. Hlavním cílem práce bylo vytvoøit IT øešení pro podporu chovu bezobratlıch ivoèichù. Dílèí cíle práce zahrnují popis problematiky chovu bezobratlıch ivoèichù a poadavkù na jejich chov, formulaci poadavkù na IT øešení a konceptuální návrh øešení, vıbìr vhodné technologie a pouitıch HW a SW komponent, stanovení metodiky pro návrh a vıvoj IT øešení pro podporu chovu, vıvoj SW a HW øešení a ovìøení správné funkce a naplnìní poadavkù. Pøi vıbìru prvkù byla pouita metoda vícekriteriálního rozhodování. Systém vytvoøenı na základì vybraného øešení je autorem vyuíván k monitorování a zajištìní podmínek pro chov. Úspìšné vyuití Internetu vìcí v teraristice je dùkazem moností jeho širokého vyuití.

titleEN: Cyber security and user awareness
titleCZ: Kybernetická bezpeènost a informovanost bìnıch uivatelù
KeywordsEN: cyber security; prevention of cyber attacks; user education
KeywordsCZ: kybernetická bezpeènost; prevence kybernetickıch útokù; vzdìlávání uivatelù
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis addresses the issue of user awareness of cyber security and threats within cyberspace. The main aim of the thesis is to determine the level of awareness and education of users about cyber security and its threats across age categories in the Czech Republic and, following the results of the research, to propose a solution to improve awareness. In the first part of the thesis, the author discusses cyber security and related concepts, individual cyber threats, and, above all, their prevention. The second part of the thesis evaluates the results of a survey conducted among users across different age categories in the Czech Republic. The methodology for data collection was a questionnaire survey distributed electronically. The questionnaire includes questions related to users&apos; education in cybersecurity, security options and risky behaviours in cyberspace. The research part also includes a summary of existing educational projects and the formulation of a self-proposal to help improve awareness of the pitfalls in cyberspace among users in consideration of the research results.
AbstractCZ: Bakaláøská práce se zabıvá problematikou informovanosti bìnıch uivatelù o kybernetické bezpeènosti a hrozbách v rámci kybernetického prostoru. titleEN: Design and implementation of a web portal for hop growers
titleCZ: Návrh a implementace webového portálu pro pìstitele chmele
KeywordsEN: PHP; SQL; responsive design; web application; hop growing; hop grower; Nette; agrarian web portal
KeywordsCZ: Nette; PHP; SQL; responzivní design; agrární webovı portál; chmelaøství; webová aplikace; pìstitel chmele
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis deals with the design and implementation of a web portal for hop growers to serve as a tool for managing and optimizing their activities in relation to hop growing. The aim of the thesis is to create a clear web application that will target a group of hop growers and provide them with all the necessary information in one place. The theoretical part deals with the research of current solutions in the field of agriculture, then the technologies used nowadays for the creation of modern web applications and the spiral model of development are described. For the model, the reasons why it was chosen for the development of this project are given. The practical part describes the complete process of web application development using the spiral model. It all starts with a requirements analysis based on the needs of the users. Based on this, the design of the web portal is created. Next, the project moves to the implementation phase. This is followed by the testing and subsequent deployment part. The whole project goes through several iterations. The results of the testing and the feedback received confirm the success of the web portal implementation. The final output of the work is a fully functional web application that allows hop growers to manage their activities in a simpler and more intuitive way. The portal not only improves harvest organisation and administrative processes, but also provides a platform for sharing relevant information and supports decision-making processes in hop growing.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce se zabıvá návrhem a implementací webového portálu pro pìstitele chmele, kterı má slouit jako nástroj pro správu a optimalizaci jejich èinností ve vztahu k chmelaøství. U modelu jsou uvedeny dùvody, pro které byl vybrán pro zpracování tohoto projektu. Praktická èást popisuje kompletní proces vıvoje webové aplikace za vyuití spirálového modelu. Vše zaèíná analızou poadavkù, která vychází z potøeb uivatelù. Na jejím základì je vytvoøen návrh webového portálu. Dále se projekt pøesouvá do fáze implementace. titleEN: Questions of Ethics and the Psychological Impact of Artificial Intelligence on Society
titleCZ: Otázky etiky a psychologickı dopad umelej inteligencie na spoloènos
KeywordsEN: artificial intelligence; deep learning algorithms; ethical questions and dilemmas; psychological impact
KeywordsCZ: umelá inteligencia; etickı otázky a dilemy; psychologickı dopad; algoritmy hlbokého uèenia
AbstractEN: This thesis focuses on the examination of the increasingly significant influence of artificial intelligence and deep learning algorithms, with a specific focus on the ethical questions and dilemmas related to the development and use of artificial intelligence, as well as the psychological impact these technologies have on society and individuals living within it. With the ever-growing presence of artificial intelligence in our lives, the importance of understanding the problems associated with its development and implementation also increases. Based on this foundation, research questions and objectives of this work were established. The first of these was to introduce the field of artificial intelligence, clearly define what is meant by the term artificial intelligence, present the historical development of this technology, and acquaint the reader with modern trends in the industry. Furthermore, the ethical dilemmas and questions associated with artificial intelligence are extensively presented. To achieve this goal, a traditional literature review and analysis of more than 20 relevant works that provide various perspectives on the issue were utilized. In addition to ethical questions, various approaches to addressing and resolving these dilemmas are analyzed. The chapter also presents different perspectives on categorizing problems and introduces conceptual philosophical issues in the design of artificial intelligence. On the topic of psychology, the paper analyzes three main ways in which artificial intelligence affects our psychology: our behavior, our mental health, and our work life. Several examples are presented in each chapter. The contributions of this work lie primarily in providing a comprehensive view of the entire issue of AI ethics, the psychological impacts on people, analysis of modern trends in the industry, and drawing conclusions about the most optimal path for addressing these problems for the future ethical and beneficial development of AI.

titleEN: Comparison of translations of generative artificial intelligence
titleCZ: Porovnání pøekladù generativní umìlé inteligence
KeywordsEN: generative artificial intelligence; neural machine translation; machine translation; translation comparison; translation metrics
KeywordsCZ: generativní umìlá inteligence; neuronovı strojovı pøeklad; strojovı pøeklad; srovnání pøekladù; metriky pøekladu
AbstractEN: The main goal of this bachelor thesis is to compare the ability of generative artificial intelligence in the translation of text against the capabilities of neural machine translation. To achieve this goal, the author presents both technologies&apos; history, basic principles, advantages, and disadvantages. As partial objectives the author examines the impact of the field of the text, the length of the text, and the direction of translation, into Czech and English, on the quality of translation. Methods of measuring the quality of translation were introduced, namely human, automated, and a combination of both approaches. The ChrF and HTER metrics, which were used in the author&apos;s empirical work, were introduced. Texts in four different fields and four different lengths were chosen for evaluation of the quality of translation. A total of eighty texts were compared in six different popular services. There were three neural machine translation services and three generative AI services. The author found that the current popular approach to translation, neural machine translation, has better results. Still, one of the generative AI services evaluated, ChatGPT-4, outperformed one of the selected neural machine translation services in the results of the author&apos;s human evaluation. According to the author&apos;s results, the quality of the translation depends on the field of the text and the direction of the translation. Specific monitored fields have significantly better results according to both metrics, and translations into English have better results than translations into Czech in all observed values. In the case of the impact of text length on the quality of the translation, the results show that the author&apos;s chosen lengths do not significantly impact the translation quality. However, as the length increases, the proportion of translations that have errors from different services increases, i.e., the number of translations of the exact text from various services that need at least one modification increases with the length. The questionnaire survey showed results similar to those found by the author.

AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis deals with the issue of the proper setting of security features in the Microsoft 365 cloud platform and their usage. The aim is to research the recommendations issued by Microsoft called Secure Score, also in the context of their licensing and availability to individual organizations. Another objective is to use a sample of organizations to identify features that are not commonly used or are incorrectly configured. The final goal is to assess key areas for improvement and make recommendations.

AbstractEN: Reservation systems play crucial role in enhancing organization, management, and customer communication across various services, from sports facilities to individual service offerings. The main objective of this thesis is to design and implement a booking system for ski school as a web application that enables clients to conveniently make online reservations while providing administrators with efficient tools for managing these bookings.  This bachelor thesis outlines the development process of a proposed web application in several detailed chapters. Initially, the thesis introduces the ski school for which the system is intended, detailing its internal operations and the fundamental requirements of the system. The following section conducts a research of existing booking systems on the market, as well as research of systems used by the competing ski schools. This thesis continues with an analysis and design of the system using the MMSP methodology.  Moreover, accompanied technologies are described in this section. Finally, the developed application is implemented using Python and Flask micro-framework. The final product is then subjected to user testing.  The conclusion of the bachelor thesis presents a fully functional web application that meets the specified criteria for defined reservation system.

titleEN: Dating apps for university students

KeywordsCZ: Seznamka; online seznamka; webová aplikace; Vue.js; Vuetify; C#; .NET
AbstractEN: With the growing need for social interaction among students, especially international students, the online world is becoming an increasingly interesting place to build community and share experiences. This bachelor thesis focuses on the development of a multilingual web application for introducing university students. The aim of the thesis is to design and implement an application that would help students to establish new social relationships more easily. The development of the application was guided by a waterfall model that includes the phases of requirements analysis, design, implementation, testing and deployment. Specifically, the technologies used in this work include Vue3.js, SASS, TailwindCSS, Axios, Typescript, Vuetify, C#, .NET, Entity Framework, and LINQ.  There are seven chapters in the thesis that cover different aspects of application development and implementation. Each chapter covers a specific topic in detail, including requirements analysis, architecture design, back-end and front-end implementation, testing, and deploying the application into production. The author collaborated directly with an external graphic designer on the user interface design and marketing part of the application, which contributed to a professional look and user-friendly environment. The result of this work is a fully functional web application called studate, available at studate.eu, which allows university students from different countries to make new social contacts through an online environment. The author of this thesis intends to launch the application into regular operation and promote it among different universities in European countries.

titleCZ: Special features and data streams of owner consent for fibre roll-out

AbstractEN: Tato bakaláøská práce si klade za cíl prozkoumat schvalování pøipojení optického internetu telekomunikaèní spoleèností, s konkrétním zamìøením na pøipojení do sklepù oproti pøipojení k bytovım jednotkám. Tento projekt pøispìje k rozvoji poznatkù o analıze telekomunikaèních dat a demonstraci praktické aplikace postupù zpracování a vizualizace dat v kontextu skuteèného podnikatelského prostøedí.
AbstractCZ: This thesis aims to investigate the approvals for fiber optic connections by a telecom company, specifically focusing on connections to basements versus connections to living units. The primary objective is to quantify and compare the number of approvals granted for these two types of connections. This new data will be then used for calculations of requested KPIs. In addition to this analysis, the study will provide a comprehensive overview of the telecommunications industry, with a specific emphasis on fiber optic technology in Germany, its evolution, and comparison to previous technologies. The research will also explore the data journey through various layers within a data architecture, including acquisition, staging, the core layer, and ultimately the export layer. Furthermore, the thesis will involve the development and implementation of a daily updated dashboard to visualize and present the findings effectively. This project will contribute to advancing knowledge in the analysis of telecommunications data and demonstrate practical applications of data processing and visualization techniques in a real-world industry context.

AbstractEN: Nowadays, information technology is an essential part of everyday life. In addition to the presentation of the offered products, claims reporting is also handled online. The goal of this work is the design and implementation of a web interface for reporting insurance claims for the Pillow insurance company, which will facilitate the process of registering insurance claims. The thesis describes the principle of reporting insurance claims and introduces the Pillow insurance company. Furthermore, the work includes an analysis of the requirements and existing solutions on the market and an analysis of the systems to which the new interface is to be connected. The main part of the work deals with the design, implementation and testing of the application, which is developed using the Angular framework. The application expanded the internal information system of the insurance company. As part of it, an insurance claim report form, and an interface for searching and reviewing the details of registered claims were created. The new interface was successfully implemented and was put into production environment. The goal of the work was fulfilled.

titleEN: Securing communication with access control system units
titleCZ: Zabezpeèení komunikace s jednotkami pøístupového systému
KeywordsEN: risk analysis; system security; security solutions; access control systems
KeywordsCZ: bezpeènostní øešení; analıza rizik; pøístupové systémy; zabezpeèení systémù
AbstractEN: The bachelor’s thesis focuses on enhancing the security of the communication layer of a selected access system through the identification of specific vulnerabilities and the design of appropriate security solutions. The work first analyses current security threats and system vulnerabilities based on user scenario and system process analysis, and then proposes technological solutions to mitigate them. The methodology includes a qualitative analysis of general risks of the access layer and human factors, and a comparative evaluation of selected security technologies assessed for their technical properties and contributions to increasing system security. The contribution is a series of specific recommendations for increasing the security of the communication layer of the examined system. These recommendations primarily focus on identified vulnerabilities relevant to the observed system, particularly strengthening trust in first-use processes and enhancing user responsibility in SSH sessions.

titleEN: Improvement of cloud infrastructure monitoring in a company providing email collaborative solution
titleCZ: Zefektivnìní monitoringu cloudové infrastruktury ve spoleènosti poskytující mailové kolaborativní øešení
KeywordsEN: monitoring; Zabbix; Grafana; Prometheus; infrastructure
KeywordsCZ: Zabbix; Grafana; Prometheus; infrastruktura; monitorování
AbstractEN: The thesis deals with the improvement of cloud infrastructure monitoring in a company providing mail collaborative solution provided in the form of Software as a Service. The current implementation of monitoring includes various issues including separate monitoring of customer servers from other cloud infrastructure, long-term data storing in the same system and related performance problems of the Zabbix monitoring server. The aim of the thesis is to improve the monitoring of cloud infrastructure and to eliminate the deficiencies. Based on the analysis of the current state of infrastructure and its monitoring, selected issues are defined and tools are chosen to achieve the goal according to the company&apos;s requirements. Following is the implementation of monitoring in high availability mode, partial consolidation of individual elements and separation of long-term trends into a separate system. When implementing test environment, great emphasis is placed on setting the dependencies of individual elements to clarify and reveal the root cause of a potential problem. The result of the work is a Zabbix cluster in high availability mode, which extends the monitoring of customer servers to fundamental infrastructure components. The cluster is used exclusively for alerting with configured dependencies. Prometheus server and Grafana are created for working with historical data. The company can use the solution as a replacement for the current implementation.

Souèasná implementace monitoringu obsahuje øadu nedostatkù, mezi které patøí oddìlenı monitoring zákaznickıch serverù od ostatní cloudové infrastruktury, uchovávání dlouhodobıch dat ve stejném systému a související vıkonnostní problémy monitorovacího nástroje Zabbix. Vısledkem práce je Zabbix cluster s vysokou dostupností, kterı rozšiøuje monitoring zákaznickıch serverù o podstatné prvky infrastruktury. titleEN: Analysis and design of Business Intelligence applications in water management companies
titleCZ: Analıza a návrh aplikací Business Inteligence ve vodárenskıch spoleènostech
KeywordsEN: Business Intelligence; Water management company; Analysis; Water; Company management; Sewerage
KeywordsCZ: Business Intelligence; Analıza; Vodné; Stoèné; Øízení spoleènosti; Vodárenská spoleènost
AbstractEN: The main objective of the bachelor thesis is the design and implementation of a pilot Business Intelligence application for a selected water management company Voda Èervenı Kostelec s.r.o. and a thorough elaboration of a standard and specific analysis of business management. It is not possible to achieve the main objective without sub-objectives. Therefore, the first sub-objective deals with the issues and characteristics of economics in water management companies and the status, development and legislation of these companies. The second sub-objective is a very detailed and in-depth analysis of a selected water company. The first part of the second sub-objective deals with a more general analysis which is very similar to other companies in this sector. However, the second part specialises specifically on water management companies and in particular on Voda Èervenı Kostelec s.r.o. Here the author obtained the vast majority of information from guided interviews with the managing director of Voda Èervenı Kostelec s.r.o., the managing director of Datainfo s.r.o. and their sales representative. The overall output of the bachelor thesis contains a theoretical description of management areas typical for water companies including a description according to the MBI methodology and a pilot BI application solution for the selected management area.

titleEN: Analysis and proposal for evaluating investments in the railway network in the Czech Republic
titleCZ: Analıza a návrh vyhodnocení investic do eleznièní sítì v Èeské republice
KeywordsEN: Rail transport; Railway infrastructure; Efficiency of railway network; Investment evaluation
KeywordsCZ: eleznièní infrastruktura; Efektivita eleznièní sítì; Hodnocení investic; eleznièní doprava
AbstractEN: Bachelor thesis focuses on analysing and proposing an evaluation of investments in the railway network in the Czech Republic. The aim of this work is to conduct an analysis of the current approach to investment assessment, identify potential shortcomings, and propose measures for its improvement and expansion. The thesis thoroughly examines the current state of the railway infrastructure from both technical and operational perspectives and subsequently conducts a comparative analysis using proposed comparable indicators with countries such as Austria, Germany, Slovakia, and Switzerland. In further sections, it addresses investment issues, including an analysis of the process of evaluating investment projects according to the departmental methodology for assessing the efficiency of transport construction projects. Additionally, expanding this assessment using technical, operational, and economic indicators is proposed. Following the proposed indicators, a basic analysis of available data necessary for their calculations is conducted. The final section of the thesis summarizes the contributions and evaluates the achievement of the set goals.

titleEN: Analysis of Applications Using Open Data
titleCZ: Analıza aplikací nad otevøenımi daty
KeywordsEN: application search; Open data; linked data; public administration; open data applications; application analysis
KeywordsCZ: Otevøená data; vyhledávání aplikací; propojená data; analıza aplikací; veøejná správa; aplikace otevøenıch dat
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis examines applications utilizing open data in public administration in the Czech Republic and compares them with applications in selected European Union countries. The main objective is to identify and analyze effective methods for searching these applications, portals, and news websites, and to create a comprehensive list of applications that will serve as a source of information on the use of open data in public administration. Furthermore, the thesis explores the focus, availability, and platforms of the individual applications to determine popular and prospective practices for using open data. The results of this work allow for a better understanding of the current state and trends in the field of open data and provide useful suggestions for improving the use of these data in public administration. The research highlights the importance of open data for increasing transparency, efficiency, and civic participation, and contributes to further development of digital transformation in the public sector.

titleEN: Analysis of the impact of healthcare availability, climatic conditions, and other factors on human lifespan
titleCZ: Analıza vlivu dostupnosti zdravotní péèe, klimatickıch podmínek a dalších faktorù na délku lidského ivota
KeywordsEN: data; dataset; correlation; linear regression; climate; life expectancy; healthy life expectancy
KeywordsCZ: prùmìrná délka ivota; klima; dataset; data; korelace; lineární regrese; prùmìrná délka ivota ve zdravém stavu
AbstractEN: The average life expectancy of a population is influenced by numerous factors. Among these factors are the environment, the quality and accessibility of medical services for the population, the social conditions in society, cultural customs, and undoubtedly, genetics. All the aforementioned factors influence population life expectancy to varying degrees, and there exist correlations or relationships between many of them. However, among these factors, there is one over which individual has little control: climatic conditions.  The climatic factor encompasses parameters such as average annual temperature, pollution levels, all of which contribute to the quality of the environment in which people reside. All the mentioned factors have an impact on the development of specific diseases within the population residing in a particular region.  This study aims to establish a correlation between climate, life expectancy and healthy life expectancy within a population by comparing life expectancies in countries located in different climatic zones, while controlling for other influential factors such as the accessibility of medical services, which also significantly impact the longevity of the population. By analyzing the occurrence of specific diseases in these climatic conditions, it is also possible to determine which climate contributes most to the emergence of diseases that may lead to fatal outcomes.

Mezi tìmito faktory patøí ivotní prostøedí, kvalita a dostupnost lékaøskıch slueb pro populaci, sociální podmínky ve spoleènosti, kulturní zvyky a nepochybnì genetika. Daná práce si klade za cíl stanovit souvislost mezi klimatem a délkou ivota populace pomocí porovnání prùmìrnıch délek ivota a délek ivota ve zdravém stavu v zemích, které se nacházejí v rùznıch klimatickıch zónách. titleEN: Analysis, Design, and Implementation of Business Intelligence Solutions for Selected Areas of Large Electrical Industry Company Managemen
titleCZ: Analıza, návrh a realizace business intelligence øešení pro vybrané oblasti øízení velké spoleènosti elektrotechnického prùmyslu
KeywordsEN: electrical industry; Qlik Sense; manufacturing company; Business Intelligence
KeywordsCZ: Qlik Sense; elektrotechnickı prùmysl; vırobní podnik; Business Intelligence
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis covers the analysis , design and implementation of a business intelligence solution for selected management areas of a large company in the electrical industry. The thesis reflects the author&apos;s theoretical knowledge and practical skills to create reports. In creating reports the author focused on the area of warehouse management. The data for each report is based on tables and transactions from the SAP ERP system. In this way, the reports can be easily implemented in any manufacturing company using this system.  To achieve this goal, the author has set several sub-objectives which include introducing the concept of BI, analyzing the electrical industry and the largest manufacturing company in the industry, defining the issues of manufacturing company management and designing and implementing reports for effective warehouse management.  The author&apos;s experience in BI, study of relevant courses at the Prague University of Economics and Business and the use of literature and digital resources contributed to the achievement of these objectives. Through a combination of practical experience and theoretical knowledge, the author was able to better understand the issues and effectively create reports that will contribute to better warehouse management of a manufacturing company. Based on the analysis and insights from the individual subtasks, the author subsequently developed Business Intelligence solution in Qlik Sense.

titleEN: A critical comparison of the features of open source data visualization tools
titleCZ: Kritické porovnání vlastností open source nástrojù pro vizualizaci dat
KeywordsEN: data; MATLAB; open source; Python; R; visualization
KeywordsCZ: MATLAB; data; open source; Python; R; vizualizace
AbstractEN: In today&apos;s world, data plays a crucial role in our daily lives, influencing our decision-making and planning. Efficient data management is essential, and data visualization is one of the key tools for data interpretation. This thesis provides an overview and comparison of open-source tools for data visualization, offering rich features for data manipulation and transformation into understandable graphical representations. It focuses on a detailed analysis of available tools in various programming languages, aiming to explore their capabilities and possibilities in the field of data visualization. Visualizations were created for each selected tool, and their functionalities were compared. The conclusion of the thesis provides recommendations for selecting an open source tool based on user needs and capabilities. In this way, the thesis contributes to better understanding and utilization of available tools for data visualization.
AbstractCZ: V dnešní dobì jsou data nedílnou souèástí našeho kadodenního ivota a mají zásadní vliv na naše rozhodování a plánování. titleEN: Motivations for choosing microservice architecture
titleCZ: Motivy volby architektury mikroslueb
KeywordsEN: Microservice architecture; microservice; software; choice of architecture; comparison of software architectures
KeywordsCZ: mikrosluba; software; volba architektury; srovnání software architektur; Mikroservisní architektura
AbstractEN: This thesis is devoted to uncovering the motives behind the choice of microservice architecture for any project as the preferred architecture in today&apos;s IT world. The thesis includes a broad literature search containing a sufficient introduction to the studied issue, a description of the most used architectures and a detailed analysis of the characteristics of microservice architecture. The research is introduced by a structured comparison of all the mentioned architectures (SOA, Monolithic Architecture, EDA and Layered Architecture) with microservice architecture. Three qualitative interviews were conducted with carefully selected industry experts and then processed using thematic analysis to obtain data for further research. As a result of the research, the findings of the thematic analysis and the literature search are compared with the differences between the two sources discussed and explained. Within the result, the thesis talks about the transition from monolithic to microservice architecture, as a frequent step in order to increase the sustainability and usability of modern applications. Furthermore, the strengths of the microservice architecture, which are the possibility of agile and rapid development, flexibility in deployment and the possibility of total optimization of the resources used. The main risks identified at the end of the analysis are design, without which the microservice architecture may lose its effectiveness, or the difficulty of integrating a multitude of heterogeneous services. Finally, the identified differences between the literature search and the interviews are the difficulty of navigating the code and its complexity, the difficulty of creating sustainable systems, and the complexity of testing and deployment. These differences are explained by the different environments, i.e., the interviews come from a professional environment, while the literature contains a wider range of information generated even in amateur settings.
AbstractCZ: Práce se vìnuje odhalení motivù volby architektury mikroslueb pro libovolnı projekt, jako preferované architektury v dnešním IT svìtì. Vızkum je uveden strukturovanım srovnáním všech zmiòovanıch architektur (SOA, Monolitní architektura, EDA a Vrstvená architektura) s architekturou mikroslueb. K získání dat pro další vızkum byly provedeny tøi kvalitativní rozhovory s peèlivì vybranımi odborníky z oboru a následnì zpracovány s vyuitím tematické analızy. A nakonec práce identifikuje rozdíly mezi literární rešerší a rozhovory, kterımi jsou nároènost orientace v kódu a jeho komplikovanost, obtínost tvorby udritelnıch systémù a komplikovanost testování a nasazování. titleEN: Multiplatform mobile app for tracking and sharing training plans with game elements
titleCZ: Multiplatformní mobilní aplikace pro sledování a sdílení tréninkovıch plánù s herními prvky
KeywordsEN: Expo; game elements; mobile apps; MongoDB; multiplatform development; React Native; fitness apps; Flask
KeywordsCZ: multiplatformní vıvoj; React Native; Expo; fitness aplikace; Flask; herní prvky; mobilní aplikace; MongoDB
AbstractEN: With the growing interest in healthy lifestyles and technological advances in mobile apps, it appears that combining fitness activities with gaming elements and social interaction can significantly increase user motivation and engagement. This bachelor thesis focuses on the design and implementation of a mobile fitness application that integrates gaming elements and promotes social interaction among users. The app is designed to be compatible with Android and iOS platforms and offer users features for creating, recording and sharing workout plans as well as tracking the activities of others. Development is done using the Expo platform and the React Native and Flask frameworks. The work is based on the agile MMSP methodology, where iterative approaches are used for efficient development. The application uses MongoDB for data management and Cloudinary for multimedia handling, while security is provided by JSON Web Token and Bcrypt technologies. The project includes iterative testing and feedback collection. The output is a working app published on the Apple App Store and ready for release on Google Play.
AbstractCZ: S rostoucím zájmem o zdravı ivotní styl a technologickı pokrok v oblasti mobilních aplikací, se ukazuje, e spojení fitness aktivit s herními prvky a sociální interakcí mùe vıraznì zvıšit motivaci uivatelù a jejich zapojení. Tato bakaláøská práce se zamìøuje na návrh a implementaci mobilní fitness aplikace, která integruje herní prvky a podporuje sociální interakci mezi uivateli. Aplikace je navrena, aby byla kompatibilní s platformami Android a iOS a nabízela uivatelùm funkce pro vytváøení, zaznamenávání a sdílení tréninkovıch plánù, stejnì jako pro sledování aktivit ostatních. Vıvoj je realizován s pomocí platformy Expo a frameworkù React Native a Flask. Práce je opøená o agilní metodiku MMSP, kde jsou pouívány iterativní pøístupy pro efektivní vıvoj. titleEN: Cross-platform mobile application for recipe management, meal planning and preparation
titleCZ: Multiplatformní mobilní aplikace pro správu receptù, plánování a pøípravu jídel
KeywordsEN: React Native; diet; recipes; Firebase; mobile app
KeywordsCZ: mobilní aplikace; React Native; stravování; recepty; Firebase
AbstractEN: Specialized software tools play an important role in the optimization of personal diet planning, as they provide their users with various options to save time and money. New and more affordable solutions also aimed at increasing the productivity of users are still being created, as the interest in such applications is growing. To meet the specific needs of users and fill the gap in this category, new mobile app is designed and developed in this thesis, which aims to make meal planning, tracking the diet and recipe inspiration easier.  The thesis introduces the area of dieting and recipes in the first place. Subsequently, the analysis of competition takes place and also potential users are interviewed. Both analyses are performed to define functional requirements. According to requirements the app design is made, which defines application architecture including processes, key tools and data sources for creating the application and also user interface. The application is implemented according to the app design and the process is described in a separate chapter. Then the app publishing process on App Store and Google Play is described. In the end there is the testing using test cases and also user testing. There are defined possible improvements for future versions according to feedback.  The application uses React Native framework for the app user interface and logic. The application uses Firebase as database and its defined functions, it also provides user authentication. The result is a mobile application, which runs on both OS Android and iOS and can provide its users better diet planning.

titleEN: Design of appropriate visualizations for selected datasets

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on exploring the field of data visualization and its ability to facilitate data analysis through the creation of appropriate visualizations.   The aim of the bachelor thesis is to describe the topic and possibilities of data visualization, the visualization tool used for creating visualizations in the practical part, select datasets and design its’ visualizations.  The bachelor thesis is structured into two main parts: theoretical and practical. The theoretical part introduces the field of data visualization, including historical development, classification, basic principles, and current trends in the field. This part also compares the most significant tools for data visualization and justifies the choice of the Qlik Sense tool, which is used in the visualization processing.  The practical part of the thesis focuses on the process of selecting datasets for a specific company, subsequent visualization design, and evaluation. Ultimately, a dataset for the specific company was selected, which already contained existing visualizations available on its web portal. Three modified visualizations were proposed as inspirational examples for  future modifications of existing graph. Subsequently, a questionnaire survey was conducted among independent experts in the field and a brief interview with the main statistician of  the chosen company to evaluate the created visualizations.  The main contribution of this bachelor thesis is the presentation of new visualization variants that offer expanded and useful technical possibilities. These variants can serve as examples for future development of existing visualizations for better data presentation and analysis.

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on describing the development of the prototype web application &quot;Prague Today&quot;, which purpose is to visualize geographic data from third-party sources, specifically data collected by the capital city of Prague. The main objective of the thesis was to design and develop a prototype application based on requirements specified by the Prague Institute of Planning and Development. The theoretical part conducts a review of methodologies and selects an appropriate development approach. The practical part describes the entire development process from defining requirements, through the design of architecture and user interface, to the implementation of the proposed solution. The design of layers as content pages was processed based on defining target user groups. The project solution was divided into two separate applications – a main application intended for users and an application for layer management. The main technologies used for developing the applications are Vue.js, Nuxt, Leaflet, and Amazon AWS cloud services. The thesis describes user and tool testing. The results of user testing show that the application is intuitive and meets its set goals. However, testing also successfully revealed a number of deficiencies. The output of this thesis is a functional and tested prototype of the application, which offers a foundation for the development of the application itself or the development of a new application based on the developed prototype.

titleCZ: Pokroèilá analıza dat s vyuitím GPT-4 code interpreter

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the use of GPT-4, an advanced language model developed by OpenAI, for advanced data analysis purposes. titleEN: Prediction of rents on the Czech housing market: An application of regression analysis
titleCZ: Predikce nájemného na èeském bytovém trhu: Aplikace regresní analızy

KeywordsCZ: regresní analıza; webová aplikace; doba návratnosti; sbìr dat; realitní trh
AbstractEN: The aim of this bachelor thesis is to apply regression analysis methods to predict rents in the housing market of the Czech Republic in order to estimate the payback period of real estate investments. The thesis is divided into theoretical and practical parts.   The theoretical part of the thesis provides a definition and overview of regression analysis methods, describes the issues of data collection and preprocessing, including obstacles that may complicate this process. It also provides theoretical insight into web applications and their development.   The practical part describes the process of data collection and preprocessing in Python, including storing the data in a database. Subsequently, the creation of a regression model using the Scikit-learn library is presented in detail. The development of an interactive web application is also presented, which provides users with an up-to-date overview of market offers and enables dynamic search for investment-worthy properties. The output of the thesis is a functional prediction model whose validity is confirmed by comparison with latest data and its implementation in a user-friendly application.

titleEN: Information security risks in smart mobility projects

AbstractEN: The aim of this bachelor thesis is to determine the level of risk perception related to information security in smart mobility projects implemented in the smart city concept. In the first and second chapters, a literature search is conducted to define the terms smart mobility, information security and identify potential information risks associated with smart mobility. Based on the risks identified in the literature search, a list was created to serve as a basis for the structured interview. The third chapter describes the data collection and analysis methodology, including a detailed approach to the guided interview and to the information risk assessment. The output of the thesis is a list of perceived risks for each project, which was compiled based on the perspective of a company representative, with an assessment of the level of risk and its subsequent breakdown into tables. The findings are then analysed and interpreted in the final discussion.

AbstractEN: The goal of this bachelor thesis is the design and development of a software solution for the optimization and automation of data preparation for wire cutting and label printing machines. This solution has been created for real deployment in a manufacturing enterprise, where it is called a Configurator. Author of this thesis applies a combination of observation, measurement, comparison, and analysis of company documents, supported by expert interviews and literature review, to achieve a theoretically informed and practically effective solution. The author describes the design and development of the software using Microsoft Excel platform according to his chosen methodological approach, the iterative and incremental model. AbstractEN: Internet of Things (IoT) and its technological security risks are a hot topic today and affect the security of enterprises that use IoT in their business. Furthermore, a methodology is organized according to which qualitative research is conducted in a telecommunications company operating the largest IoT network in the country for commercial use. The utility of the thesis is to create an overview of how IoT and its network risks are perceived by a leading IoT integrator in the Czech Republic.

titleEN: The impact of artificial intelligence on the credibility of information and the creation of disinformation content
titleCZ: Vliv umìlé inteligence na dùvìryhodnost informací a tvorba dezinformaèního obsahu
KeywordsEN: artificial intelligence; threat; deepfake; disinformation content; comparation
KeywordsCZ: dezinformaèní obsah; deepfake; hrozba; komparace; umìlá inteligence
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis deals with the topic of artificial intelligence and its role in the creation of disinformation content. The aim of the thesis is to conduct a theoretical overview of the given area, make basic analytical conclusions and supplement them with a qualitative analysis of selected case studies. In the theoretical part, potential threats from artificial intelligence are first presented, then the concept of &quot;disinformation content&quot; is defined, and lastly, generative artificial intelligence is placed in the context of the creation of disinformation. In the research part, a qualitative analysis of selected case studies is carried out. The selection of case studies was limited to the issue of deepfake attacks. Individual cases are first briefly presented and then compared with each other based on established criteria. The result of the comparison is the answering of the research questions and the formulation of a universal theory, which tries to generalize the ideas from the individual cases so that it can subsequently be applied to similar problems and serve as a guide on how to avoid and prevent attacks using deepfake technology.

AbstractEN: The objective of this bachelor’s thesis is to conduct an experimental analysis of the performance of various cloud platforms designed to determine sentiment in social media posts. The study will focus on assessing the efficiency, reliability, and scalability of these platforms based on predefined criteria and identifying their strengths and weaknesses. As a secondary objective, the influence of different sentiment analysis models on the results will be explored. The experiment will be conducted with at least three different cloud platforms and will use at least three different sentiment analysis models across at least five datasets. The results will be presented and interpreted to provide a comprehensive overview of sentiment analysis in the context of social media and others sites and evaluate the effectiveness of cloud technologies for this task. This thesis aims to contribute to a deeper understanding of how cloud-based tools can be utilized for efficient processing of large volumes of data and accurate sentiment analysis in social media.

AbstractEN: The thesis deals with the analysis and optimization of the process of user device exchange in the IT department of the Institute of Clinical and Experimental Medicine. titleCZ: Analıza a optimalizace procesù v laboratoøi

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis deals with the analysis and optimization of processes in a private laboratory in Prague, specializing in biochemical, immunological and hematological tests. AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis deals with the use of social network X, formerly known as Twitter, by official accounts of European politicians as a means of political marketing. The main aim of the thesis is to establish the extent of activity of top politicians who represent individual European countries both within the European Union and outside of it, in the case of the United Kingdom. One of the sub-objectives is to collect contemporaneous data using specialist software designed for this purpose and to quantify the engagement of individual politicians on a social platform appropriately. The work loosely builds on previous research with a similar title, from 2020 and 2022, which was undertaken by Mgr. Jana Syrovátková, Ing. Jiøí Korèák and Ing. Antonín Pavlíèek, PhD from the Department of Systems Analysis at the University of Economics in Prague. One of the final goals is to compare current data with past data that were part of the previous research. These data are then clearly visualized using the PowerBI tool. The results of this work can be of informative value to politicians who actively use social platforms or to the public interested in the link between politics and social networks. Last but not least, the work is also beneficial for those interested in learning more about the issue of data scraping on social network X.

titleEN: Analysis of viral values <U+200B><U+200B>of posts on social networks
titleCZ: Analıza virálních hodnot pøíspìvkù na sociálních sítích
KeywordsEN: social networks; Twitter; X; viral content; web scraping; Facebook
KeywordsCZ: virální obsah; web scraping; X; Facebook; sociální sítì; Twitter
AbstractEN: Currently, social media plays a key role in sharing information, it is important to understand how posts go viral. The content of this bachelor thesis is based on the analysis of viral values of posts on social networks Facebook and X. The methodology involves collecting data using automatic scrapers from selected social networks and their subsequent analysis. From the conclusion of these analyses, it follows that the elements of post structure that increase the tendency of a post to go viral include visual elements such as images and emoticons. Furthermore, posts with a shorter text section are more likely to create viral content. In contrast, inserting a link to an external site reduces the likelihood that the post will gain viral coverage. A factor that differently affects posts on followed social networks is the hashtag. On Facebook, hashtags have proven to be a factor that reduces the chances of a post going viral, while on X, the opposite is true. The results of this work provide a basic overview of the structure of viral content on social networks and provide recommendations for creating more viral posts and optimizing strategies to achieve wide reach and higher user engagement.

titleEN: Data mining on betting odds data of football matches

KeywordsCZ: data mining; dobıvání znalostí z databází; LISp-Miner; sázkové kurzy; 1. èeská fotbalová liga
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis examines the use of data mining techniques on betting odds of football matches in the Czech First League spanning from the 2016/2017 season to the 2022/2023 season. Given the very extensive data from previous years, we can use data mining techniques to predict the best possible bets with the goal of profit. The theoretical part focuses on the CRISP-DM methodology, which includes the phrases of problem understanding, data understanding, data preparation, modeling, evaluation, and deployment of results. The practical part is structured by this methodology. The introduction of LISp-Miner system is also included in the theoretical part. In the practical part of the work, data mining steps are used on selected data from data acquisition to interpretation of analysis results. Modeling is implemented in LISp-Miner environment, using 4ft-Miner, CF-Miner and SD4ft-Miner procedures, which are used to solve predefined analytical questions. The results of the analysis are then displayed and further analyzed in the MS Office Excel system. The main goal is to find long-term trends in betting odds and to find ideal bets for generating profit.

titleEN: Harmful Content Generation: ChatGPT-4, Gemini, and Cybersecurity
titleCZ: <U+200B>Generování škodlivého obsahu: ChatGPT Plus, Gemini a kyberbezpeènost
KeywordsEN: Cybersecurity; cyber security; LLM; Large language models; ChatGPT-4; Gemini
KeywordsCZ: Kyberbezpeènost; kybernetická bezpeènost; ChatGPT-4; LLM; Velké jazykové modely; Gemini
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the issue of using ChatGPT-4 and Gemini tools for generating malicious content with potential risks to cybersecurity. It provides theoretical foundations regarding cybersecurity, LLM models, their tools, and the problems these technologies pose to cybersecurity today. Moreover, the practical part demonstrates the ability of the examined tools to generate malware, ransomware, phishing emails, keyloggers, and SQL injections. Using these tools, a simple malicious program was also successfully created based on a predetermined scenario. The practical analysis revealed that both tools can generate a wide range of contents that could be a potential risk to cybersecurity. It was found that even users without advanced knowledge can use these tools to create malicious content, with the key to success being the correct formulation and language of commands. This finding emphasizes the need for further research around prompt engineering and examining how different language variants affect the outputs from LLM tools or models.

Nabízí teoretické základy ohlednì oblasti kybernetické bezpeènosti, LLM modelù, jejich nástrojù a problémù tìchto technologií pro kybernetickou bezpeènost v souèasnosti. titleEN: Drafting and development of a children's camp games database for the Children and Youth Centre along with support for camp programme planning
titleCZ: Návrh a vytvoøení databáze dìtskıch táborovıch her pro Dùm dìtí a mládee s podporou tvorby programu tábora
KeywordsEN: games database; camps database; camp games; web application; children&apos;s camp planning; Children and Youth Centre; MySQL; PHP
KeywordsCZ: databáze her; databáze táborù; Dùm dìtí a mládee; PHP; táborové hry; plánování dìtskıch táborù; webová aplikace; MySQL
AbstractEN: Bachelor thesis deals with the optimization of the process of planning and organization of children&apos;s camps in the Prague Children and Youth Centre. The current method of camp preparation is often a lengthy, demanding and overall inefficient process. Camp programmes are filed in a very disorganised manner and their eventual recycling is challenging. The aim of this thesis is to design a database of children&apos;s camp games for the Children and Youth Centre with the possibility of adding games to the programs of individual camps and to subsequently create it in the form of a simple web application. The first part of the thesis focuses on identifying the problems in the camp games filing process through semi-structured interviews with camp leaders. It also analyses the current situation in the field of children&apos;s camps, along with evaluating existing Czech projects on camp games filing systems. The analysis of the requirements for the intended application is the next part of the work, followed by the database design and the actual development of the web application in the PHP programming language. The resulting application is tailored to the needs of the Children and Youth Centre and allows easy creation and registration of camp programmes with the possibility of adding games. Testing of the implemented solution was carried out by putting it into practice during the preparation of two suburban camps, thus testing the vast majority of the application&apos;s functionality. As a result, the application proved to be functional and useful when used for its intended purposes. However, further development is possible and recommended, as it would be useful to extend the application with a few more functionalities that would broaden its level of usability.

titleEN: Design of sports data visualization methods for Yarmill
titleCZ: Návrh metod vizualizace sportovních dat pro spoleènost Yarmill
KeywordsEN: visualization; data; sport; dashboard
KeywordsCZ: vizualizace; dashboard; data; sport
AbstractEN: The aim of the work is to create visualizations from the sports environment in the form of a dashboard for Yarmill. A secondary goal is to create a handbook that will be implemented as an internal standard and describes recommendations for creating visualizations and dashboards. The theoretical part defines the important areas for fulfilling these objectives. In the first part, the reader is introduced to the basics of cognitive psychology with an emphasis on gestalt principles. Next, the reader learns what type of visualization to choose based on the category of data available. The penultimate section discusses what distracting elements of visualization exist and how to avoid them based on principles and recommendations from various authors of books on effective data visualization. The theoretical part concludes with a chapter on strategic communication elements such as text, colour and position and how to use these elements to attract attention of users. The practical part describes the process of creating individual dashboards. First, the reader learns about the assignment, why a football environment was chosen and other specifics of the solution. Subsequently, he can read about the initial sketches and how they were transformed into a digital environment to the final design. Finally, another output of this work in the form of an internal company handbook is described.

titleEN: Suggestion to improve ADAS Function testing
titleCZ: Návrh na zlepšení testování ADAS Funkcí
KeywordsEN: Automotive Technology; ADAS Functions; Automation; Testing
KeywordsCZ: Testování; Automobilové technologie; ADAS funkce; Automatizace
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the feasibility and improvement of testing Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) functions of the second level of driving automation (L2 - Partial automation), which is its main goal. The secondary goals are to introduce the issue of ADAS functions as a whole, to analyze existing test solutions, and to compare their results. The added value of the thesis is to improve and speed up the testing of new versions of ADAS functions. The thesis is motivated by the need to improve and streamline the testing process of ADAS functions, which play a crucial role in modern automotive technologies. ADAS, or Advanced Driver Assistance Systems, are technologies designed to increase driving safety and comfort. Although these systems offer many advantages, their testing is complex and time-consuming. Therefore, this thesis focuses on designing more efficient and faster testing methods in a virtual environment. This makes the thesis highly beneficial for the company, which is one of the reasons for choosing this topic. The thesis aims to bring new perspectives and solutions for testing ADAS functions, which can lead to significant improvements in this field.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce se zamìøuje na proveditelnost a vylepšení testování Advanced Driver Assistance Systems (ADAS) funkcí druhé úrovnì automatizace øízení (L2 – Partial automation), co je její hlavní cíl. Vedlejšími cíli jsou pøedstavení problematiky ADAS funkcí jako celku, analıza existujících øešení testù a srovnání jejich vısledkù. ADAS neboli pokroèilé asistenèní systémy pro øidièe, jsou technologie navrené tak, aby zvıšily bezpeènost a pohodlí øízení. titleEN: Optimization and simulation of odds betting
titleCZ: Optimalizace a simulace kurzovıch sázek
KeywordsEN: database; betting; game theory; neural network
KeywordsCZ: teorie her; databáze; sázení; neuronová sí
AbstractEN: The topic of the bachelor&apos;s thesis is &quot;Optimization and simulation of odds betting&quot;. The aim of the work is to create neural network models based on a dataset of tennis matches, which would enable the prediction of match results.   The work consists of a theoretical and a practical part. In the theoretical part, key terms from the field of betting, game theory, database systems and neural networks are defined and described. The practical part includes the implementation and creation of the infrastructure of the development environment. First, the data used in the practical part are described here, and then the data are modified for uploading to a database. Next, the practical part explains the procedures for creating and training two models $-$ a static model created using the TensorFlow tool and a dynamic model created using the NEAT neuroevolutionary algorithm.  The results of both models are eventually compared to determine their effectiveness and accuracy in predicting the winners of tennis matches. The models are simulated on real betting opportunities to determine the potential profitability of the strategies based on the predictions of these models. This work contributes to the understanding and the use of technological tools for the analysis and optimization of odds betting strategies and can serve as a starting point for future research into the application of machine-learning models.

Praktická èást zahrnuje implementaci a vytvoøení infrastruktury vıvojového prostøedí. Nejprve jsou zde popsána pouitá data a následnì jsou data upravena pro nahrání do databáze. Dále jsou v praktické èásti vysvìtleny postupy vytvoøení a natrénování dvou modelù $-$ statického modelu vytvoøeného pomocí nástroje TensorFlow a dynamického modelu vytvoøeného pomocí neuroevoluèního algoritmu NEAT.  Vısledky simulací obou modelù byly následnì porovnány, aby bylo moné urèit jejich úèinnost a pøesnost v predikci vítìzù tenisovıch zápasù. Modely byly simulovány s vyuitím skuteènıch sázkovıch pøíleitostí, aby se zjistila potenciální vınosnost strategií zaloenıch na predikcích tìchto modelù. Tato práce pøispívá k pochopení a vyuití technologickıch nástrojù pro analızu a optimalizaci strategií kurzovıch sázek a mùe slouit jako vıchozí bod pro budoucí zkoumání aplikace modelù strojového uèení.

titleEN: Online community rating platform
titleCZ: Platforma pro hodnocení online komunit

AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis describes the development of a web application designed to increase the safety and transparency of online communities on the Discord platform. This platform, originally serving primarily computer game players, is gaining popularity among a wide user base, which presents challenges regarding the safety of the platform’s users. The main objective of this thesis is to provide a solution to these challenges through a tool in the form of a publicly available web application. This tool allows users to rate the communities contained within it, giving them the ability to share their own experiences with the communities in question and fosters a safe and informed environment. The theoretical research examines the growing popularity of the Discord platform, the risks associated with its use and the parental monitoring tools currently available. It also looks at current trends and technologies used to develop web applications. Depending on the technological research and the requirements set, the T3 Stack technology is selected for the implementation of the solution. The design of the application is created and then the process of its development, deployment to the production environment and testing is described. The final section includes a discussion about the level of successful implementation of the solution, the shortcomings of the application and its potential for future improvements.

titleEN: Differences between the technical aspects of a public 5G network and a private 5G network for Industry 4.0
titleCZ: Rozdíly technickıch aspektù veøejné 5G Sítì a privátní 5G sítì pro Prùmysl 4.0

KeywordsCZ: Prùmysl 4.0; technologie; privátní 5G sí; 5G; veøejná 5G sí
AbstractEN: With the transition to the fifth generation of 5G mobile networks, new possibilities are opening for industrial applications, especially in Industry 4.0, where speed and reliability are key parameters. This bachelor thesis focuses on comparing the technical aspects of public and private 5G networks in the context of Industry 4.0. The aim of the thesis is to evaluate the differences in technological aspects between private and public 5G networks. These aspects include maximum data download and upload speed, latency and others.  The practical part of the work includes laboratory measurements to test private 5G network and field measurements to test public 5G network in Prague and other locations. The measurement results and observations of other technical aspects, such as frequency bandwidth, packet loss, flexibility and security, will be analysed and used to compare the two networks. Understanding these differences is crucial to fully exploit 5G technology in industrial environments and further innovation in Industry 4.0.

titleEN: Social networks as a marketing tool
titleCZ: Sociální sítì jako marketingovı nástroj
KeywordsEN: data analysis; online marketing; social networks; parliamentary elections; political marketing
KeywordsCZ: online marketing; analıza dat; sociální sítì; politickı marketing; parlamentní volby
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis deals with the topic of political marketing using social networks by political parties and coalitions before the Polish parliamentary elections in 2023. The first objective is to find out how active the selected political parties are on social networks. That goal is achieved by finding out the number of published videos and posts compared to the number of views or likes obtained. In the theoretical part, the terms marketing, marketing mix and political marketing are explained. Next are introduced the selected political parties and social networks Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and X, formerly known as Twitter. The second goal is to find out whether some of the selected political parties did not use the offered form of paid advertising on the selected social networks, and if so, to find out the approximate costs they spent on it and the response they received. In the practical part, the procedure for obtaining data and its subsequent analysis for individual political parties and coalitions and specific social networks is explained.

titleEN: Social networks as a brand marketing tool

AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis deals with social networks, which are nowadays increasingly coming to the fore in the marketing world. The main objective of this thesis is to gain a deeper knowledge of the use of social networking in marketing and to study the tactics and strategies of brands in the digital space for future use. titleEN: Application of ChatGPT-4 in Phishing Detection
titleCZ: Vyuití ChatGPT-4 pro detekci phishingu
KeywordsEN: ChatGPT-4; Cybersecurity; Phishing; Artificial Intelligence
KeywordsCZ: ChatGPT-4; Kybernetická Bezpeènost; Phishing; Umìlá Inteligence
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis explores the use of the ChatGPT-4 language model for phishing detection. The aim of the study is to analyze how this advanced artificial intelligence model can contribute to improving cybersecurity measures in identifying phishing content. The theoretical part introduces the ChatGPT-4 model, its structure, and operating principles. The practical section focuses on testing the model’s capabilities to recognize phishing in web URLs and email communications. The thesis includes detailed testing of the model against various tactics used in phishing attacks and evaluates its effectiveness. The research demonstrates that ChatGPT-4 has significant potential in phishing detection but also highlights certain limitations and the need for further development to enhance its accuracy and reliability. The conclusion reflects the results achieved and outlines possible directions for future research in the use of artificial intelligence to increase cybersecurity.

titleEN: The Usage of mHealth in the Treatment of Inflammatory Bowel Disease
titleCZ: Vyuití mHealth v léèbì idiopatickıch støevních zánìtù
KeywordsEN: mHealth; Inflammatory bowel disease; IBD
KeywordsCZ: Idiopatické støevní zánìty; IBD; mHealth
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis is focused on the usage of mHealth apps in the treatment of inflammatory bowel disease. The aim of the first part of the thesis is to introduce mHealth and inflammatory bowel disease to the reader. The second part of the thesis then identifies the key functionalities of the apps in the context of inflammatory bowel disease, based on my analysis of existing studies of these apps, followed by a questionnaire survey. The questionnaire survey also serves to get awareness of the use of these apps among patients.  A semistructured interview with a physician is then used to discuss the acquired functionalities of these apps and their potential use in standard medical practice. The main outcome of this thesis include the identified functionalities of mHealth applications, analysis of the use of the applications and functionalities by patients in the Czech Republic, and an evaluation of the use of the analysed functionalities in connection with medical practice, together with a suggestion for the implementation of these functionalities.
