titleEN: Using large language models for information extraction with applications in knowledge graphs
titleCZ: Vyuití velkıch jazykovıch modelù pro extrakci informací s aplikacemi ve znalostních grafech
KeywordsEN: Large language models; RDF statements; ChatGPT
KeywordsCZ: Velké jazykové modely; RDF tvrzení; ChatGPT
AbstractEN: The bachelor’s thesis focuses on using large language models for information extraction with applications in knowledge graphs. The theoretical part offers research on the definition of information extraction and its types. Next, research about knowledge graphs and using large language models is conducted. The thesis contains a subsection given to data sources and reliable data websites, introducing a Wikipedia ranking list. The practical part of the thesis focuses on a validation script in Python for verifying RDF statements from Wikidata.  The thesis covers the current state of using large language models for information extraction and knowledge graph engineering. It shows the differences between less and more capable language models. A Python script was implemented and tested on 3 Wikidata subjects. A manual evaluation was performed which again showed a gap between different language models but on the other hand suggested a possible combination of different models to optimize the process and deliver better and faster results.
AbstractCZ: Bakaláøská práce se zamìøuje na vyuití velkıch jazykovıch modelù pro extrakci informací s aplikacemi ve znalostních grafech. Èást je vìnována datovım zdrojùm a jejich dùvìryhodnosti. Praktická èást se vìnuje validaènímu skriptu pro verifikaci RDF tvrzení z portálu Wikidata. titleEN: Usage of Large Language Models for Rules Induction based on the Examples from Text
titleCZ: Vyuití velkıch jazykovıch modelù pro indukci pravidel na základì pøíkladù z textu
KeywordsEN: ChatGPT; Bing Chat; Copilot; CSV; Google Bard; Google Gemini; GUHA; itemsets; association rules; Apriori algorithm; FP-Growth algorithm; EasyMiner; support; confidence; Python
KeywordsCZ: podpora; spolehlivost; ChatGPT; Bing Chat; Copilot; CSV; Google Bard; Google Gemini; GUHA; itemsety; asociaèní pravidla; algoritmus Apriori; algoritmus FP- Growth; Python; EasyMiner
AbstractEN: The presented thesis addresses the possibility of using large language models for frequent pattern searches. Following the terms of reference of the thesis, which was to experimentally verify the ability of the LLM to induce general rules describing common characteristics of a given small number of examples, the thesis consists of three objectives. The main objective is to experiment with freely available language models (LLMs). The other objectives consist of a search of the procedures for the LLMs and an evaluation of the experiments, including a comparison with an existing approach for rule finding compared to Apriori and FP-Growth algorithms. In this thesis, experiments were conducted with three LLMs (Copilot, Gemini, and ChatGPT-3.5) in combination with eight prompt tasks focused on writing the frequent groups of items that occur in some versions of the small input dataset. In the original version, the dataset consisted of familiar column names and their values (names of the animals and their characteristics). In other versions, the actual information was masked and replaced with meaningless identifiers. The best results were obtained from the Copilot model, which scored up to 100% accuracy in the datasets with meaningless identifiers, but significantly lower than in the original data. A similar trend, where meaningless identifiers lead to better results could be spotted in the ChatGPT-3.5 model (if the result counts as the arithmetical mean of all eight experiments). It is questionable if this procedure would work on larger datasets and other domains.
AbstractCZ: Pøedkládaná práce se zabıvá moností vyuití velkıch jazykovıch modelù pro hledání èastıch vzorù. V návaznosti na zadání práce, kterım bylo experimentálnì ovìøit schopnost LLM indukovat obecná pravidla popisující spoleèné charakteristiky zadaného malého poètu pøíkladù, se práce skládá ze tøí cílù. Hlavním cílem jsou experimenty s volnì dostupnımi jazykovımi modely (LLM). Další cíle tvoøí rešerše postupù pro LLMs a vyhodnocení experimentù vèetnì porovnání s existujícími pøístupy pro nalézání pravidel za pouití algoritmù Apriori a FP-Growth. V rámci práce byly provedeny experimenty se tøemi LLMs (Copilot, Gemini a ChatGPT-3.5) v kombinacemi s osmi zadáními promptù zamìøenımi na vypsání èastıch mnoin poloek vyskytujících v nìkolika verzích malého vstupního datasetu. Ve vıchozí verzi obsahoval dataset všeobecnì známé názvy sloupcù i jejich hodnoty (názvy zvíøat a jejich vlastností). V dalších verzích byly postupnì tyto údaje zamaskovány a nahrazeny bezvıznamovımi identifikátory. Nejlepších vısledkù dosáhl Copilot, kterı dosahoval a 100 % správnosti u datasetu s bezvıznamovımi identifikátory, ale vıraznì niší správnosti na pùvodních datech. Podobnı trend, kdy bezvıznamové identifikátory vedly k lepším vısledkùm, byl patrnı i u modelu ChatGPT-3.5 (poèítá-li se vısledek jako aritmetickı prùmìr všech osmi experimentù). Je otázkou, zda by tento postup fungoval i na vìtší datasety a jiné domény.

titleEN: League of Legends Professional Player Game Analysis
titleCZ: Analıza her profesionálních hráèù League Of Legends
KeywordsEN: esport; vision; k-means; League of Legends; Mann-Whitney U test; clustering; Spearman&apos;s rank correlation
KeywordsCZ: Mannùv-Whitneyho test; shluková analıza; Spearmanùv koeficient; vize; League of Legends; k-means; esport
AbstractEN: The aim of this thesis is to investigate the differences in the way European and South Korean professional players play League of Legends. To do this, data collected using the RIOT API regarding the Ranked Solo/Duo game mode was used. It was found that there are significant differences between the two groups, even for aspects of the game that are of great importance in professional matches such as vision. In terms of methodology, observation, comparison and analysis using the Mann-Whitney U test, clustering and Spearman&apos;s correlation coefficient were used. The Python programming language was utilized for the calculations.

titleEN: Sentiment analysis of football tweets
titleCZ: Analıza sentimentu fotbalovıch tweetù
KeywordsEN: football; natural language processing; sentiment analysis; social media; X (formerly  Twitter)
KeywordsCZ: sociální média; X (døíve Twitter); zpracování pøirozeného  jazyka; analıza sentimentu; fotbal
AbstractEN: In the digital era, social media, particularly the platform X (formerly Twitter), has become a key space for public discourse about sports, including football. This bachelor&apos;s thesis analyzes the sentiment of football tweets to understand the moods and opinions of fans globally, focusing on the 2022 FIFA World Cup and the 2023 Women&apos;s World Cup. The methods used include traditional models like Naive Bayes and Support Vector Machines, and advanced technologies such as BERT. Results demonstrate that modern technologies are more precise and adaptable in evaluating sentiment. This study provides new insights for fan engagement strategies and sports marketing, and highlights the potential of NLP techniques in social media.

Tato bakaláøská práce analyzuje sentiment fotbalovıch tweetù s cílem pochopit nálady a názory fanouškù celosvìtovì; zamìøuje se na Mistrovství svìta ve fotbale 2022 a Mistrovství svìta ve fotbale en 2023. Pouité metody zahrnují tradièní modely jako Naive Bayes a Support Vector Machines a dále pokroèilé technologie jako BERT. Vısledky ukazují, e modernìjší technologie jsou pøesnìjší a adaptabilnìjší ve vyhodnocování sentimentu. Tato práce pøináší nové poznatky pro strategie zapojení fanouškù a marketing ve sportu a ukazuje potenciál technik NLP v sociálních médiích.

titleEN: Analysis of the Current State of Research on Artificial General Intelligence (AGI)
titleCZ: Analıza souèasného stavu prací v oblasti obecné umìlé inteligence (AGI)
KeywordsEN: artificial intelligence; AI; AGI; technological singularity; superintelligence
KeywordsCZ: umìlá inteligence; AI; AGI; super inteligence; technologická singularita
AbstractEN: This undergraduate thesis examines the topic of Artificial General Intelligence. Its goals are describing the role of AGI in the broader field of AI, analyzing current research in the fields of AI and neuroscience, as well as communicating expert opinions about AGI’s feasibility and future development. The thesis also explores the relationship between AGI and the concept of technological singularity, including contemporary views of its likelihood. Whilst describing AGI, this thesis also presents theories behind the nature of AGI. The importance of AGI in the field of artificial intelligence is steadily growing, becoming a major focus of research and investment in the private sector. The current trend in AGI development is deep learning, as well as reinforced learning with human or AI feedback. Previous assumptions about the feasibility of large language models as a path towards AGI are getting reconsidered, with OpenAI’s models taking the spotlight this year. Brain emulation is conversely trailing behind, with its most recent breakthrough being highly detailed imaging of a mouse brain. Major figures in the AI sphere display notable optimism about the realization of AGI within the foreseeable future, with key milestones expected by 2045 at the latest. This optimism, however, is tempered with concerns over the potential negative consequences of AGI for human civilization. Most notable figures in the field of AI urge the importance of aligning AI development with human ethics to mitigate risks and ensure beneficial outcomes.

Souèasnım trendem ve vıvoji AGI je hluboké uèení a posílené uèení s lidskou nebo AI zpìtnou vazbou. Døívìjší pøedpoklady o pouitelnosti velkıch jazykovıch modelù jako cesta k AGI jsou v souèasnosti pøehodnocovány, pøièem modely spoleènosti OpenAI se v roce 2023 dostaly do popøedí zájmu. Naopak emulace lidského mozku zaostává; nejnovìjším prùlomem je zatím detailní sken myšího mozku. Vıznamné osobnosti v oblasti AI vykazují opatrnı optimismus ohlednì realizace AGI v dohledné budoucnosti, s klíèovımi milníky oèekávanımi nejpozdìji do roku 2045. Tento optimismus je však zmíròován obavami z potenciálních negativních dùsledkù AGI pro lidskou civilizaci. Odborníci zdùrazòují vıznam sjednocení vıvoje AGI s lidskou etikou, aby se minimalizovala rizika a zajistily pøínosné vısledky.

titleEN: Automated categorization using Azure AI Language
titleCZ: Automatizovaná kategorizace pomocí Azure AI Language

AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis deals with the automatic categorization of text using the advanced tools of Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning of the Azure AI Language service. It specifically focuses on the recognition of inventory records contained in textual data. The goal of this work is to implement the practical use of Azure AI Language for effective recognition and sorting of inventory items. The research carried out as part of the work provides a deeper insight into the issue and current trends in the field of automatic text categorization using Azure AI Language functions. Testing the implemented tools will enable practical verification of their effectiveness and reliability. The results of this work should contribute to a better understanding of the capabilities and limitations of the Azure AI Language for automated text categorization, with an emphasis on practical applications in the field of inventory record recognition.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce se zabıvá automatickou kategorizací textu prostøednictvím pokroèilıch nástrojù umìlé inteligence a Machine Learningu sluby Azure AI Language. titleEN: Customizace LLM-specifickıch modulù v rámci ChatGPT
titleCZ: Customization of LLM-specific modules within ChatGPT
KeywordsEN: ChatGPT; AI; Customizace; LLM; GPTs; Pøizpùsobitelnost

AbstractEN: Cílem dané bakaláøské práce je vyvinuti dvou odlišnıch speciálních verzí ChatGPT urèené pro konkrétní moduly od základù a vyhodnotit, zda tyto pøizpùsobené verze fungují lépe a jsou snazší na pouívání ve srovnání se standardním ChatGPT. Motivací pro tuto práci je rostoucí zájem a monosti pro vytváøení pøizpùsobenıch verzí ChatGPT. Klíèovımi aspekty jsou pouitelnost, rozdíly oproti standardnímu modelu a snadnost pouívání. Kromì toho je zde osobní zájem zjistit, zda zùstanou vytvoøené pøizpùsobené modely uiteèné i po dokonèení této práce a zda nabídnou jakékoli budoucí aplikace. Tato práce je rozdìlena do dvou hlavních èástí: teoretické a praktické. Teoretická èást poskytuje komplexní pøehled a úvod do velkıch jazykovıch modelù, popisuje specifika generativních pøedtrénovanıch transformátorù (GPT). Zabıvá se zásadním konceptem promptù, diskutuje, jak je mohou uivatelé efektivnì vyuívat. Dále tato èást popisuje sloitosti jemného ladìní a zásady RAG v kontextu tìchto modelù. Praktická èást práce popisuje vıvoj dvou odlišnıch speciálních verzí ChatGPT. První verze je navrena tak, aby pomáhala s tvorbou ivotopisù, zatímco druhá je pøizpùsobena pro pomoc uivatelùm v pøípravì na Test znalosti japonského jazyka (JLPT) a také uèitelùm s plánováním hodin a školními úkoly. Tato èást nejen podrobnì popisuje proces vytváøení, ale také zkoumá konkrétní funkcionality a aplikace kadé pøizpùsobené verze. Ve závìru bakaláøské práce byly shrnuty vısledky hodnocení pøizpùsobenıch modelù ChatGPT, vèetnì celkového hodnocení kadé verze na základì jejich vıkonu. Závìr také nastínil potenciální aplikace pro tyto specializované GPT, navrhuje zpùsoby, jak by mohly bıt efektivnì zaèlenìny do pøíslušnıch oblastí za úèelem zlepšení úkolovì specifickıch funkcionalit a zkušeností uivatelù.
AbstractCZ: The goal of this thesis is to develop two distinct custom versions of ChatGPT tailored for specific modules from scratch, and to evaluate whether these customized versions perform better and are easier to use compared to the standard ChatGPT. For the evaluation and comparison, experts in relevant fields will be invited to test these large language models and provide their insights. The motivation for this thesis stems from the growing interest in and possibilities for creating customized versions of ChatGPT. Key considerations include usability, differences from the standard version, and ease of use. Additionally, there is a personal interest of the author in determining whether the custom models created will remain useful beyond the completion of this thesis and if they will present any future applications. This thesis is divided into two main sections: theoretical and practical. The theoretical part provides a comprehensive overview and introduction to large language models, describing the specifics of Generative Pre-trained Transformers (GPTs). It covers the essential concept of prompts, discussing how they can be effectively utilized by users. Additionally, this section describes the complexities of fine-tuning and the principles of RAG in the context of these models. The practical part of the thesis describes the development of two distinct custom versions of ChatGPT. The first version is designed to assist with creating resumes, while the second is tailored to aid users in preparing for the Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT), as well as helping teachers with lesson planning and school-related tasks. This section not only details the creation process but also examines the specific functionalities and applications of each customized version by the experts. In the conclusion of the thesis, the evaluation results of the customized ChatGPT were summarized. The conclusion also outlined potential applications for these specialized GPTs, suggesting ways they could be effectively integrated into relevant fields to enhance task-specific functionalities and user experiences.

titleEN: Generative artificial intelligence and the issue of disinformation
titleCZ: Generativní umìlá inteligence a problematika dezinformací
KeywordsEN: generative artificial intelligence; artificial intelligence; AI; deepfake; disinformation; ChatGPT
KeywordsCZ: AI; deepfake; dezinformace; generativní umìlá inteligence; ChatGPT; umìlá inteligence
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis examines artificial intelligence (AI) and its impact on the spread and detection of disinformation. Currently, this issue is a highly discussed topic that directly and indirectly affects us all. The thesis explores artificial intelligence itself, with an emphasis on generative artificial intelligence. Additionally, it focuses on the topic of disinformation, explaining the mechanisms of its spread, its impact on society, and ultimately the fight against it. In the conclusion of the theoretical part, these two topics are combined, highlighting the dual role of AI, which can be used both for production and identification of disinformation. Besides providing a summary overview of this issue, the thesis&apos;s merit lies in the implementation of a questionnaire survey and demonstration of the use of ChatGPT for evaluating news articles. In a specialized environment, a custom GPT was created, which shows promising results in evaluating individual articles with regard to present disinformation features. However, several issues arose during its development, which partially limit this GPT&apos;s abilities. This thesis concludes by presenting the results of a questionnaire survey, revealing how people perceive AI and their ability to recognize content created by artificial intelligence.

titleEN: Mobile Application for Self-Assessment of Teacher Student Competencies: Test Automation
titleCZ: Mobilní aplikace pro sebehodnocení kompetencí studentù uèitelství: Automatizace testování
KeywordsEN: mobile application; appium; test automation; robot framework
KeywordsCZ: automatizované testování; mobilní aplikace; robot framework; appium
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis focuses on the design and implementation of a set of automated tests for the SeK mobile application, utilizing Robot Framework and Appium technologies. The main goal of the thesis is not only to support the testing process and improve the quality of the application but also to prepare the complete infrastructure necessary for effective automated testing. This includes the entire chain of activities from setting up the devices on which the tests will be performed to the selection of appropriate technologies, and the analysis and evaluation of the results obtained. In the theoretical part, readers are provided with an introduction to the field of automated testing, where definitions, types of tests, and basic principles are presented. Subsequently, the main reasons for implementing automated tests are explained. This part continues by introducing the domain area of the SeK application, which focuses on formative assessment and student self-assessment. The practical part of this thesis is divided into seven chapters, documenting the entire process in detail, from the initial design to the final implementation of the executable automated test suite. Each chapter systematically documents the steps that led to the successful completion of the main objective of the thesis. It introduces the methods and procedures that were applied during the development process. At the end of the thesis, the test suite is evaluated to ensure its quality assurance.

titleEN: Mobile Application for Self-Assessment of Teacher Student Competencies: Business analysis and UX design
titleCZ: Mobilní aplikace pro sebehodnocení kompetencí studentù uèitelství: Byznys analıza a UX design
KeywordsEN: UX design; UI design; Graphical user interface design; Business analysis; Mobile application; Formative assessment; Self-assessment; Professional development; Self-development; Teaching
KeywordsCZ: Mobilní aplikace; Formativní hodnocení; Sebehodnocení; UX design; UI design; Návrh uivatelského rozhraní; Byznys analıza; Profesní rozvoj; Seberozvoj; Uèitelství
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis concerns the user experience design of a mobile application used for the professional development of student teachers. The objective is to analyse the user requirements and to design the user interface of a mobile application for self-assessment of students at the Faculty of Education at Masaryk University in Brno. The theoretical framework introduces the definition of user interface and user experience, and the key principles for their design. It also discusses user experience design specifics for self-development applications. Furthermore, it introduces the concept of formative assessment and its part in self-evaluation, describing their role and form of use at the Faculty of Education at Masaryk University. At the beginning of application requirements analysis, the vision, expected format and specific needs of the principals were analysed. The results were then further elaborated into smaller, unambiguous units, which were formulated into user stories with research among students. User stories were then established as the scope for the user interface design. A simplified form of research was conducted among students using an in-depth interview method. The outcomes of this research supported the purpose of the application, its potential benefits and contributed to the specification of its requirements. The user interface design was constructed according to the fundamental principles and standards of usability and in alignment with the visual style of Masaryk University. The design transformed the specified requirements into a tool for student self-reflection and professional development. The design was subsequently handed over for further development, resulting in the creation of an application for self-assessing the competence of student teachers based on the initial design. The creation of the aforementioned mobile application has the potential to enhance the quality of education provided at the Faculty of Education of Masaryk University, or other educational institutions.
AbstractCZ: Bakaláøská práce se zabıvá návrhem uivatelského rozhraní mobilní aplikace vyuívané pro profesní rozvoj studentù uèitelství. titleEN: Mobile Application for Self-Assessment of Teacher Student Competencies: A mobile application for student teacher competency self-assessment: API and Database Design and Implementation
titleCZ: Mobilní aplikace pro sebehodnocení kompetencí studentù uèitelství: Návrh a implementace API a databáze
KeywordsEN: Mobile Application; Server-side application; CI/CD; GraphQL; NestJS; Postgres; Database; API; Javascript; Node.js; Self-Assesment; Docker
KeywordsCZ: Sebehodnocení; Docker; Serverová aplikace; Postgres; Mobilní aplikace; Node.js; CI/CD; NestJS; GraphQL; Databáze; API; Javascript
AbstractEN: The bachelor&apos;s thesis is devoted to the issue of self-evaluation of student teachers. Its goal is to design and implement a server application providing an application programming interface (API) for a mobile application used for self-evaluation of teacher students at the Faculty of Pedagogy of the Masaryk University in Brno. The application was developed with the help of MMSP methodology - agile development in combination with Lean and Scrum agile methodologies. Together with the application, the database model and the automatic deployment process were designed.  In the introduction, the author introduces the key concepts that must be known when developing a server application. It further explains the concepts related to the domain part of the application and presents the standard of quality of the professional competences of the student teacher, which was behind the creation of the requirements of this application. The reader is introduced to the entire development process, from the methodology, through the selection of tools, to the design and implementation of individual parts of the solution. The author presents all the tools and technologies he used to achieve his goals and design and develop an application that provides an API. At the end of the work, the author focuses on the process of continuous deployment of the application and its maintenance and monitoring of server performance. In the final chapter, he then evaluates his own processing, points out shortcomings and shows the possibilities of how the application can be further developed.  The result of this bachelor thesis is a fully functional server application providing an API for a mobile application intended for the self-evaluation of teacher students. A robust database model has been created that is fully compatible with mobile application functionality, and a continuous deployment process has been established with an emphasis on automation, maintenance and server performance monitoring. This application facilitates the self-evaluation of teaching students at the Faculty of Pedagogy of the Masaryk University in Brno and offers a solid basis for further development and improvement of functionality.

KeywordsCZ: Sbìr dat; Dotazníkové platformy; Google Forms; SurveyMonkey; Qualtrics; Vyplnto; Srovnání dotazníkovıch platforem; Dotazníkové šetøení; Vızkum; Microsoft Forms
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis is devoted to a comparative analysis of questionnaire platforms with the main objective of identifying and assessing their specific features and usage rates among economics students. The first part of the thesis includes a detailed analysis of the functionalities of questionnaire platforms and the methodology of questionnaire construction. In the empirical part, first, an analysis of data collected from academic papers in the Czech Republic and Denmark is conducted, based on which the most commonly used questionnaire platforms by students of economics are subsequently identified. These platforms include Google Forms, SurveyMonkey, Qualtrics, Microsoft Forms and Vyplnto. These platforms, are key to the following section in which a comparative analysis is conducted. Based on the comparison of the platforms, a meta-survey is designed to reveal the preferred functionalities and platforms by the students.

titleEN: Comparing Large Language Models: Analysis of Functionality and Limitations
titleCZ: Porovnání velkıch jazykovıch modelù: Analıza funkcionality a omezení
KeywordsEN: natural language processing; artificial intelligence; comparison of LLM performance; Czech language; large language models
KeywordsCZ: zpracování pøirozeného jazyka; srovnání vıkonnosti LLM; èeskı jazyk; velké jazykové modely; umìlá inteligence
AbstractEN: In recent years, the field of artificial intelligence and machine learning has evolved at an unprecedented rate, with large language models (LLM) being a key element of this development. These models have become fundamental tools in many applications from natural language processing to content generation and solving complex problems. This bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on comparing the performance of selected LLM with an emphasis on the Czech language to explore their ability to understand and generate content in this specific linguistic context. The work evaluates and compares the capabilities of models such as GPT-3.5, Claude 3 Sonnet, and others in areas that include text comprehension, grammar, mathematics, and biology. Quantitative data were obtained through standardized tests, including high school didactic tests and SCIO tests, and supplemented with qualitative analysis of the models&apos; responses. Special attention is given to identifying specific errors and limitations of these models in the context of the Czech language, revealing key areas for further development and improvement. The results suggest that despite an elevated level of knowledge in domains, such as biology, LLM face significant challenges in areas requiring deeper linguistic understanding and complex logical reasoning, especially in mathematics and advanced Czech grammar. This work contributes to a better understanding of the possibilities and limitations of LLM in the Czech linguistic environment and offers valuable insights for research communities and developers of artificial intelligence. Discussions of the results and recommendations for future research emphasize the need for expanded data sets and algorithm improvements to enhance the universality and accuracy of LLM.

Kvantitativní data byla získána prostøednictvím standardizovanıch testù, vèetnì maturitních didaktickıch testù a SCIO testù. Dále byla doplnìna kvalitativní analızou odpovìdí modelù. Speciální pozornost je vìnována identifikaci konkrétních chyb a limitací tìchto modelù v kontextu èeského jazyka, co odhaluje klíèové oblasti pro další vıvoj a zlepšení. Vısledky naznaèují, e i pøes vysokou úroveò znalostí v nìkterıch doménách, jako je biologie, LLM èelí vıznamnım vızvám v oblastech vyadujících hlubší lingvistické porozumìní a komplexní logické úvahy, zejména v matematice a pokroèilé gramatice èeštiny. AbstractEN: Tato práce se zabıvá aplikací rùznıch modelù strojového uèení na pøedpovídání poptávky po elektøinì, co je klíèová souèást efektivního øízení energetickıch zdrojù. Hlavním cílem této práce je pøedstavit modely strojového uèení pouívané pro pøedpovídání poptávky po elektøinì a tyto metody porovnat. Dalšími cíli podporujícími hlavní cíl jsou pøispìní k optimalizaci nìmecké energetické sítì, ukázka praktického pouití na reálnıch datech a pøíprava na budoucí vızkum. Tyto cíle byly naplnìny s vyuitím literatury a zkušeností autora. K realizaci celé praktické èásti byl pouit programovací jazyk Python. Vısledkem této práce je struèné srovnání rùznıch modelù, jako je lineární regrese, XGBoost a long short-term memory neuronová sí.
AbstractCZ: This thesis explores the application of various machine learning models to power demand forecasting, a crucial component in the efficient management of energy resources. The main goal of this thesis is to introduce the machine learning models used for forecasting power demand and compare those methods. Additional goals supporting the main goal are contributing to the optimization of the German energy grid, demonstration of the practical application using real data, and preparation for future research. Those goals were fulfilled by using literature and the author’s experience. Python programming language was used to implement the whole practical part. titleEN: Prediction models for e-Sport matches in League of Legends
titleCZ: Predikce e-sportovıch zápasù v League of Legends
KeywordsEN: decision tree; machine learning; regressive analysis ; League of Legends; LoL; prediction models; logistic regression; random forest; esport
KeywordsCZ: League of Legends; LoL; modely predikce; logistická regrese; náhodnı les; rozhodovací strom; esport; strojové uèení; regresivní analıza
AbstractEN: The presented bachelor thesis aims to explore the application of predictive models based on regression analysis for the League of Legends European Championship (LEC) from the game League of Legends (LoL). Methods of comparison, observation, data analysis, and document analysis were used. Data from domains managing historical match statistics were used to create prediction models. The tool which was used to process data and create all models was the programming language Python with library extensions for data analysis. All steps were done in Jupyter environment. The first task of the thesis focuses on modeling a logistic regression with minimal accuracy of 50 %. Subsequently, two additional algorithms for decision tree and random forest are created. All models are compared with the goal of finding the best option for predicting esports matches. Metrics of accuracy, precision, recall, and F1 score are used for evaluation. The models created provide a suitable basis for future developments of more advanced solutions for neural networks and real-time predictions.

titleEN: Predicting the results of esports matches
titleCZ: Predikce vısledkù Esportovıch zápasù
KeywordsEN: logistic regression; esport; Counter-Strike; prediction
KeywordsCZ: esport; Counter-Strike; logistická regrese; predikce
AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis investigates predictions of esports matches using logistic regression. More specifically, in games Counter-Strike: Global Offensive and Counter-Strike 2(CS:GO, CS2). Data analysing and data processing is done with using esport databases. Logistic regression model is generated using R programming language. A method of structured interview was crucial for obtaining information about esport teams and for making predictions. A method of data analysis was used to create descriptive statistics. The prediction model was generated using the logistic regression method. The main data source for this thesis is esport database HLTV. The obtained data is then copied and analysed in Excel with using the function of descriptive statistics. The final dataset is used as input data for the code in RStudio. The code in R is made using external libraries and packages for generating graphics. After the use of statistical functions, the output is a generated logistic regression model. This estimated model is then described using relevant metrics in the field of prediction models. With the completed prediction model, the goal of this thesis has been achieved. The final logistic regression model predicts esports matches with accuracy of 66 %. It was also calculated that the variable containing the difference in world ranking of the teams has the greatest influence on the prediction. In this case, the accuracy of the logistic regression model is not sufficient to reliably estimate esports matches, even though the overall value is satisfactory.

titleEN: Software support for asynchronous communication between parent and pediatrician

KeywordsEN: mHealth; asynchronous communication; parent; pediatrician
KeywordsCZ: pediatr; asynchronní komunikace; mHealth; rodiè
AbstractEN: This bachelor’s thesis focuses on the design of a mobile application to support asynchronous communication between parents and pediatricians. In the first part, a literature review was conducted in order to better understand the communication needs in a healthcare setting, with an emphasis on the specifics of the asynchronous approach. In the second part, a questionnaire survey among parents was organized to identify key requirements and preferred functionalities of the application. The collected data was used in the third part of the thesis to define functional and nonfunctional requirements and to create detailed use cases that addressed specific user needs. The thesis also includes a class diagram, an application architecture design that describes how to send messages using a message queue and exchange health records using standardized protocols. The thesis also includes user interface design using the design of individual screens of the mobile application.

titleEN: Use of perceptual maps to examine the relationship of macroeconomic indicators
titleCZ: Vyuití perceptuálních map ke zkoumání vztahu makroekonomickıch ukazatelù

KeywordsCZ: Hrubé úspory domácností; Saldo vládního rozpoètu; Vıvoj ekonomiky v Evropské unie v letech 1995 a 2022
AbstractEN: This work should help to answer the question to what extent household savings and the government budget balance are related and examines the validity of the relationship between the indicators. We work here with publicly available data from Eurostat from 1995 to 2022 for selected 23 countries from the European Union. A modified paired t-test is used for the analysis, with the help of which we test spatial changes in the Gaussian plane. Perceptual maps are used to visualize and describe the development of these indicators over time.

titleEN: Using statistical methods to predict results in combat sports
titleCZ: Vyuití statistickıch metod pro predikci vısledkù v oblasti bojovıch sportù
KeywordsEN: web scraping; mixed martial arts; machine learning; data analysis; Elo; predictive models; MMA; UFC
KeywordsCZ: smíšená bojová umìní; strojové uèení; Elo; analıza dat; prediktivní modely; web scraping; MMA; UFC
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis deals with the use of statistical methods for the prediction of results in mixed martial arts (MMA), especially in UFC fights. The aim of the thesis was to contribute to a better understanding of the factors influencing match outcomes, to implement predictive models and thus provide useful insights into the sport. The thesis is structured in five parts, which include understanding the sport, obtaining, processing and cleaning the input data, analyzing the key variables affecting the outcomes and the way fights are finished, and implementing predictive models. The analysis examined, among other things, the physical characteristics of the fighters, their previous matches, external match conditions, and the historical development of match finishing methods. Selected machine learning models and an Elo model were created to predict match outcomes and finishing methods. This paper presents a comprehensive approach to the analysis and prediction of sporting outcomes using modern statistical techniques and python programming language libraries. The main contribution of the work is seen by the author in particular in the accuracy of the prediction of one of the models for the match finishing method.

titleEN: Analysis and Design of Information System for Companies in Orthotic-Prosthetic Sector of Healthcare
titleCZ: Analıza a návrh informaèního systému pro spoleènosti v ortoticko-protetickém sektoru zdravotnictví

AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis provides the foundation for design of a complex enterprise information system usable in the orthotic-prosthetic healthcare sector. The findings are compared with the functionality of the current application portfolio and the need for a new information system is identified. Furthermore, information system development methods and enterprise information systems are described, and available solutions on the Czech market are presented. Qualitative research methods, namely interviews and observations, were used in the thesis. To maximize the success rate of the project, the work emphasizes close cooperation between analyzed companies. Author provides a set of recommendations for the contractors and for the future development of the information system.

titleEN: Efficiency and effort analysis of automated and manual application testing
titleCZ: Analıza efektivity a pracnosti automatizovaného a manuálního testování aplikací
KeywordsEN: regression testing; testing metrics; testing efficiency and effort; manual testing; automated testing; release

AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis analyses the efficiency and effort of automated and manual application testing in a specific company. The subject of analysis is further specified to regression testing in regular releases. Methods used include systematic literature review, unstructured interviews, comparison, analysis, and discussion. Through analysis, metric calculation, and interpretation, the efficiency of tests, defect acceptance, testing effort, automation coverage, and success of automated tests were determined. Based on these findings, the author provides suggestions for improving the monitored processes in the studied company, specifically updating test cases or more thorough documentation of automated testing. The thesis also includes a discussion by the author, focusing on a retrospective of the methods used and the way the objectives were achieved, or not achieved.

titleEN: Analysis of Conversational Text-Based Artificial Intelligence Behavior Focused on Undesirable Behavior
titleCZ: Analıza chování konverzaèní textové umìlé inteligence zamìøená na neádoucí chování

AbstractEN: Conversational text-based artificial intelligence is becoming increasingly prevalent, presenting various benefits and drawbacks. This thesis focuses on the behavior of the conversational text-based artificial intelligence ChatGPT 3.5 from OpenAI in terms of logical fallacies, cognitive biases, and phenomena of behavioral economics. It identifies undesirable behaviors and potential risks associated with this AI through analysis and testing. The results suggest the possibility of manipulating AI using logical fallacies and confirm that AI can replicate hu- man biases. Furthermore, they indicate that the undesirable behavior of AI can have serious societal implications even in the realm of business.

titleEN: Tools Supporting Inclusive Design of Digital Product
titleCZ: Nástroje podporující inkluzivní design digitálního produktu
KeywordsEN: Digital products; Tools for accessible design; UI design; Inclusive design; Accessibility; Application design; UX design; Accessibility esting tools; Website design
KeywordsCZ: Inkluzivní design; Pøístupnost; Digitální produkty; Webovı design; Design aplikací; UX design; Nástroje pro testování pøístupnosti; Nástroje pro pøístupnı design; UI design
AbstractEN: This work focuses on inclusive design of digital products, particularly websites and applications. It provides insights into methods and tools for testing and adapting these products to be accessible to the widest range of users. The contribution of this work is the creation of recommendations for designers and creators of digital products, encompassing both theoretical practices for inclusive design and practical tools and procedures for verifying its correctness. In the theoretical part, the work defines basic concepts such as design, UX/UI design, visual design, and general design principles, and discusses their relationship to inclusivity. It also includes an introduction to related legislation, including the European Accessibility Act and its implementation in the Czech legal environment. Additionally, the theoretical part presents two studies highlighting the importance of integrating the right design process into product development. The practical part uses market research and practical testing to compile recommendations on which tools can be used in design and which procedures designers should follow to meet not only the goals of the widest range of users but also the goals of the digital product creators. Selected tools are applied to a practical example, demonstrating the verification of accessibility of a specific website. The aim of the work is to motivate creators of digital products to adopt effective design and comply with legislation, provide a theoretical framework and advice for creating more accessible products, and offer an overview of suitable tools. The conclusion summarizes the main findings and recommendations for inclusive design.

titleEN: Mobile app redesign and prototype creation

KeywordsCZ: redesign; prototyp; mobilní aplikace; Design Thinking; trendy v UX
AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis focuses on the redesign and prototype creation for the mobile GIS application Kimobil, utilizing the Design Thinking methodology and current trends in UX design. The aim of the thesis is to enhance user experience, modernize the interface, and integrate new features requested by users. The theoretical part addresses the disciplines of application design, methodologies in UX design, and provides a detailed exploration of the Design Thinking methodology and characteristics of a well-designed prototype. Furthermore, it identifies the fundamental trends in today&apos;s UX design. The practical section includes an analysis of the current state of the application, market competitors, target groups and stakeholders. This is followed by the design process, in which user research is conducted, problems are defined, ideas are generated, a prototype is designed, and testing is undertaken using the Design Thinking methodology. The research is carried out through in-depth interviews with application users. The prototype is designed following traditional practices such as heuristics, Gestalt principles, human interface guidelines, and applies the defined trends. In conclusion, the prototype is tested with users through testing scenarios, and the results are evaluated together with a check to ensure that the goals have been met.

KeywordsEN: SSBI; Self service business intelligence; Power BI; IT cost management
KeywordsCZ: Self service business intelligence; Power BI; Øízení ekonomiky IT; SSBI
AbstractEN: The aim of this bachelor thesis is to design and implement a Self-Service Business Intelligence (SSBI) solution for detailed IT cost analysis. The main objective of the thesis was to create a tool in the form of interactive dashboards to enable better and more effective decision making in IT budget planning in an enterprise environment.  The theoretical part of the thesis is devoted to the basic concepts in the field of SSBI, followed by a delving into the topic of IT economic management with emphasis on the role of IT cost analysis, which provides the necessary theoretical framework for the following practical part. In this part, the process of designing and implementing the solution, then testing and evaluating user feedback is described using a concrete example. The resulting product will be used by the company management for IT cost tracking and will be further useful for other departments in the company for IT cost development and budget planning.

AbstractEN: The bachelor thesis focuses on the development of a responsive web application using a low-code platform. AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis explores the experience of novice software testers with the Robot  Framework libraries for GUI test automation. The main objective of this thesis is to  investigate, map and evaluate the experience of novice testers. The thesis is divided into  four parts. The first part introduces the basic concepts of test automation. Then the Robot  Framework tool and the Browser Library and Sikuli Library are introduced. The second part  of the thesis deals with the design of the case study. The third part of  the bachelor thesis presents the results of the practical part of the study and the interviews,  which were analysed using thematic analysis and then presented according to the logical  units obtained during the coding of the interviews. The fourth part of the thesis is a  discussion of the results. Here the results of the qualitative research are related to the  research questions that were defined in the study design. The last part is the conclusion  where the objectives of the thesis and its contribution are evaluated.

titleEN: Bitcoin adoption in society and the reasons for it
titleCZ: Adopce bitcoinu ve spoleènosti a dùvody pro ni
KeywordsEN: bitcoin adoption; payment systems; bitcoin; cryptocurrencies; financial innovation; social acceptance
KeywordsCZ: bitcoin; adopce bitcoinu; kryptomìny; finanèní inovace; platební systémy; spoleèenská akceptace
AbstractEN: The purpose of this paper is to explore current state of bitcoin adoption and to find out what reasons people have for using it. The theoretical part of the thesis takes a comprehensive look at the perceived failure of traditional financial systems as one of the main reasons why bitcoin came into existence and why many people use it. The next section establishes the state of current diffusion in the world, with a follow-up investigation to find out the reasons and circumstances of bitcoin use by individuals. It focuses on exploring whether they have different knowledge about fiat currencies, technological knowledge of bitcoin, awareness of government regulations and how these topics influence their attitude towards bitcoin.
AbstractCZ: Úèelem této práce je prozkoumat momentální stav adopce bitcoinu a zjistit, jaké dùvody lidé mají pro jeho pouití. Další èást zjišuje stav momentálního rozšíøení ve svìtì s návazností na rešerši monıch dùvodù k adopci bitcoinu. Praktická èást pomocí rozhovorù zjišuje dùvody a okolnosti pouívání bitcoinu u jednotlivcù. Zamìøuje se na prozkoumání toho, zda mají rùzné znalosti ohlednì fiat mìn, technologické znalosti bitcoinu, povìdomí o státních regulacích a jakı vliv tyto témata mají na jejich postoj k bitcoinu.

titleEN: AI chatbots and information search
titleCZ: AI chatboti a vyhledávání informací
KeywordsEN: searching; internet; chatbot; AI; information
KeywordsCZ: informace; internet; AI; vyhledávání; chatbot
AbstractEN: The content of this thesis is to describe tools designed for searching information on the internet. This work is divided into two parts – theoretical and practical. In the theoretical part, I describe the tools, their usage for better quality information searches, and how they function. Half of the theoretical work is dedicated to traditional tools for searching both scholarly and non-scholarly information. The second half of the theoretical part is focused on AI chatbots, where I discuss the technologies and principles upon which they operate. I also provide examples of AI chatbots and methods of their usage. For the practical part, I chose a quantitative research method through a questionnaire survey among students of the Faculty of Informatics and Statistics at the Prague University of Economics and Business, who are at their bachelor studies. In the survey, I asked students about the tools they use to search for scholarly and non-scholarly information on the internet. Then, I focused on their experiences and methods of using AI chatbots during information searches and their utilization in studies.

titleEN: Analysis and implementation of BI applications for a wholesale company

AbstractEN: The main objective of the Bachelor thesis is to design and implement business intelligence for a selected wholesale company. The plastics market, where operates the company, is characterized in the first part of the thesis. This is followed by company analysis, focusing on the organizational structure, information system and important standard and key management areas which can potentially be the subject of the resulting business intelligence solution. The analysis of the company is followed by the collection of its requirements and the actual rough design of the business intelligence, which uses dimensional and data modelling methods. In the last part of the thesis, the main objective is completed, meaning the design of the final business intelligence solution and its implementation within the company.  Four dashboards of specific areas of the company’s management in Power BI are the result of the Bachelor thesis. They show important indicators that emerged from the analysis of the company and its requirements. The dashboards can be used to improve the performance and efficiency of individual management areas as well as to manage the entire company. On the other hand, they can help to prevent problems associated with specific areas.

titleEN: Analysis and Design of Two-Factor Security Verification for Users in Mobile Banking

AbstractEN: This bachelor&apos;s thesis focuses on the analysis and design of two-phase security verification (2FA) for users in mobile banking. Subsequently, an analysis of the current state of cybersecurity in banking was conducted. The thesis examines international standards related to cybersecurity and the impacts of their implementation in mobile banking. The author compares various methods of two-factor authentication used across selected Czech banks. The result of this bachelor&apos;s thesis is the proposal of a specific process model for a particular Czech bank to increase the level of cybersecurity in the banking environment through two-phase user verification. The two-phase verification model is designed in accordance with the principles of BPMN, which are defined in the ISO/IEC 19510:2013 standard. The design considers both technological aspects and the user perspective, aiming to ensure an efficient and user-friendly system.

AbstractEN: The subject of this paper is to introduce the process of software development from initial analysis (requirement gathering) to implementation and verification. The thesis describes most of the phases of the SDLC cycle on a real project of creating a new information system for the Czech branch of NEWTON Media company.  The main objective of the thesis is to analyse and define the existing communication problem between the client support and data production departments and to further solve this problem by implementing a new information system according to the needs of the company. The new information system should help to improve the quality of data transfer between the departments mentioned above.  In the introduction part of the thesis, the company in question is analysed, and two key management areas, customer support and data production, are presented. The thesis then deals with collecting and analysing user requirements using guided in-person interviews and a pre-prepared set of questions.  The central part of the thesis is primarily technical. The reader is introduced to key concepts in software development that are directly relevant to the development within the thesis. In addition to the fundamental concepts, the reader is also introduced to the technologies used, including Elastic search, .NET, and Vuejs.  The implementation chapter further introduces the reader to the different settings of the development environment and the configuration of Elastic using Docker.  In the last sections, the prototype of the information system is presented to the selected employees and validated with them. The thesis concludes by further presenting possibilities for future extensions of the system.

titleEN: Analysis of Game Economy Definition

AbstractEN: The thesis deals with the analysis of the definition of economy and economic systems in computer games. The basic principles of game economics are briefly described in a historical perspective as games have evolved. In order to comprehensively evaluate the creation of an economy in a game, a list of questions and criteria was created, which were then answered by the development studios. The thesis focuses on specific computer games with interesting economies, where the definition of the economy is then evaluated based on experiments and interviews with players and developers. Finally, possible principles for defining game economics, their advantages, disadvantages, pitfalls and challenges are described based on the individual games studied.

AbstractEN: This thesis deals with the analysis of YouTube recommendations for different types of child accounts. titleEN: Digitalization in financial administration, analysis and evaluation of the Czech Republic in the EU context
titleCZ: Digitalizace ve finanèní správì, analıza a hodnocení ÈØ v EU kontextu
KeywordsEN: Digitalization; Financial administration; MOJE danì; DIS+; Information systems
KeywordsCZ: Digitalizace; Finanèní správa; Informaèní systémy; MOJE danì; DIS+
AbstractEN: This thesis focuses on digitalization in public administration, specifically in financial administration. The aim of the bachelor thesis was to analyse and evaluate digitisation in the Financial Administration of the Czech Republic with a specific focus on the information systems (IS) MOJE danì and DIS+ in comparison with other EU countries. The theoretical basis of the thesis was gathered by research and analysis of available foreign and Czech sources dealing with the issue of digitalization in public administration with a focus on financial administration. The thesis presents the basic stages of e-government development together with its key factors. It also describes the digitisation of public administration in the Czech Republic with a focus on the digitisation of the Financial Administration of the Czech Republic. The thesis introduces standards for enterprise informatics management, namely ITIL and CobiT. Subsequently, multi-criteria decision making is introduced in the thesis together with the Analytic Hierarchy Process (AHP) method. The thesis then presents the choice of components of multi-criteria decision making in order to compare selected tax information systems of the Czech Republic, Slovak Republic and the Republic of Poland, focusing on the choice of evaluation criteria based on information from the theoretical framework. An analysis of tax information systems of selected neighbouring EU countries is conducted. The thesis includes empirical research aimed at collecting and analysing user experience and feedback through a questionnaire survey. The tax information systems of the selected countries were then compared using the multi-criteria decision making method AHP, where the optimal alternative was determined from a set of tax information systems of neighbouring EU countries according to the established evaluation criteria.

Tyto závìry budou pouity k vytvoøení mitigation plánu , kterı bude obsahovat konkrétní akce a strategie k eliminaci nebo sníení identifikovanıch rizik. Bude vybrán vhodnı rámec (napø. NIST, COBIT 5, ISO 31 000...) k øešení rizik spojenıch s dokumentací SDLC, a budou dodreny doporuèení v doporuèené literatuøe a vhodné metody pro tuto oblast pøi provádìní kvalitativního vızkumu.  V závìreèné èásti provede student hodnocení teoretické a praktické èásti, vèetnì diskuse o svıch vlastních závìrech.
AbstractCZ: This bachelor thesis focuses on ensuring compliance with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) documentation in large enterprises and managing the risks associated with SDLC. The theoretical part of the project analyses in detail the key concepts associated with the SDLC and highlights the importance of documentation management in the software development process. It also discusses various SDLC methodologies and models that are in use in practice and can be implemented in large enterprises to ensure the quality and efficiency of software development. The literature research in the theoretical part will discuss the importance and benefits of documentation management within SDLC and provide an overview of relevant standards and norms in this area. It will also explore the obstacles and challenges that large enterprises may face when implementing an SDLC and the strategies that can be used to overcome them. The practical part will focus on the application of Risk Management methods to name the causes and consequences associated with the different level and quality of documentation produced during the SDLC. Appropriate qualitative research methods (interviewing, observation, experiment and document analysis...) will be used to develop the risk matrix. Emphasis will be placed on interviewing at least ten qualified professionals working in the field of software development and risk management. The interviews will be conducted to cover key aspects of the SDLC documentation and will focus, in particular, on issues related to risk identification and management. During the interviews, respondents will be asked to evaluate current practices in their companies and to identify areas for improvement. Based on the qualitative research with interviews and thematic analysis methods conducted, key conclusions will be drawn and key risks associated with ensuring compliance with SDLC documentation will be identified. These findings will be used to develop a Mitigation Plan that will include specific actions and strategies to eliminate or reduce the identified risks. An appropriate framework (e.g. NIST, COBIT 5, ISO 31 000...) will be selected to address the risks associated with SDLC documentation and the recommendations in the recommended literature and appropriate methods for this area will be followed when conducting qualitative research. In the final part, the student will carry out an evaluation of the theoretical and practical part, including a discussion of his own conclusions.

titleEN: Qualitative research on high school seniors' attitudes towards fully autonomous personal vehicles
titleCZ: Kvalitativní vızkum pøístupu k plnì autonomním osobním vozidlùm mezi maturanty
KeywordsEN: qualitative research; autonomy; autonomous vehicles; technology adoption
KeywordsCZ: pøijímání technologie; autonomie; kvalitativní vızkum; autonomní vozidla
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis explores research on attitudes of high school seniors towards fully autonomous personal vehicles. Its main objective was to find out how autonomous vehicles are perceived, which concerns are related to them and for what reasons they arise. Autonomous vehicles were defined in this thesis as vehicles that are able to replace a driver for at least a part of journey. Research in this area is important because of the ever-increasing level of vehicle autonomy, which is controversially accepted by people. Qualitative research was chosen to meet the aim of this thesis. The research was based on guided semi-structured interviews with ten high school seniors from Prague. The interviews were evaluated by thematic analysis using the MAXQDA expert program. A total of 530 codes were generated and divided into three themes including personal experience, impression of the technology, and perceived benefits and concerns. Based on traditional literature search, the four research questions were determined. The first question deals with the influence of current habits on the relationship with autonomous vehicles. According to the participants, current habits do not have any influence. However, it is believed that the perception of autonomous vehicles is influenced by the environment in which the participants usually occur and with which they compare their expectations of autonomous vehicles. The second question addresses the attitude towards driving and its influence on the perceptions of autonomy in transport. The research shows that a positive attitude towards driving leads to a stronger tendency to reject autonomous vehicles. The third question focuses on perceptions of privacy, data security and the possibility of a hacker attack. Participants were aware of privacy issues but mostly did not think of data security and the possibility of vehicle hacking. One of the main results of the thesis is the finding that although the issue of privacy is often mentioned, it does not fundamentally affect the participants&apos; perception of autonomous vehicles. The fourth question focuses on the concerns of interviewees and the ability of car companies to mitigate these issues through their communications. Unpredictable situations were found to be a major concern, stemming from a lack of confidence in higher level of automation. An interesting contribution of this thesis was the participants&apos; opinion that the automotive industry cannot alleviate their fears through communication; therefore, they need personal or mediated experience to trust autonomous vehicles.
AbstractCZ: Tato bakaláøská práce se zabıvá vızkumem pøístupu k plnì autonomním osobním vozidlùm mezi maturanty. Hlavním cílem bylo zjistit, jak jsou autonomní vozidla vnímána, jaké obavy s nimi souvisejí a z jakıch dùvodù vznikají. Autonomní vozidla jsou v této práci definována jako vozidla, která jsou schopna alespoò na èást své jízdy plnì zastat èinnost øidièe. Vızkum v této oblasti je dùleitı z dùvodu stále se zvyšující úrovnì autonomie vozidel, co je lidmi rozporuplnì pøijímáno. Pro splnìní cíle práce byl zvolen kvalitativní vızkum, kterı byl zaloen na øízenıch polostrukturovanıch rozhovorech s deseti maturanty z Prahy. Vyhodnocení rozhovorù probìhlo tematickou analızou s vyuitím expertního nástroje MAXQDA. Vzniklo celkem 530 kódù rozdìlenıch do tøí témat, kterımi jsou osobní zkušenosti, pocity z technologie a vnímané pøínosy a obavy.  Na základì tradièní literární rešerše byly zvoleny ètyøi vızkumné otázky. První se zabıvá vlivem souèasnıch návykù na vztah k autonomní dopravì. Dle úèastníkù vızkumu nemají souèasné návyky vliv, autor se však domnívá, e vliv má prostøedí, ve kterém se zúèastnìní bìnì vyskytují a s kterım porovnávají své oèekávání od autonomních vozidel. Druhá vızkumná otázka øeší vztah k øízení a jeho vliv na vnímání autonomie v dopravì. Vızkum ukazuje, e pozitivní vztah k øízení vede k vìtší tendenci odmítat autonomní vozidla. Tøetí vızkumná otázka se vìnovala vnímání soukromí, bezpeènosti dat a moného hacknutí vozidla. Participanti vızkumu si jsou vìdomi problematiky soukromí, avšak vìtšinou nepøemıšleli nad bezpeèností dat a monım hackerskım útokem na vozidlo. Jedním z hlavních vısledkù práce je zjištìní, e i kdy je problematika soukromí èasto zmiòována, tak dle participantù zásadnì neovlivòuje jejich vnímání autonomních vozidel. Ètvrtá vızkumná otázka se zamìøuje na obavy a monosti automobilky tyto obavy mírnit svojí komunikací. Hlavní obavou jsou nepøedvídatelné situace, které pramení z nedùvìry ve vyšší úrovnì automatizace. Zajímavım pøínosem této práce je i názor participantù, e automobilka nedokáe pomocí komunikace jejich obavy mírnit, e potøebují osobní, pøípadnì zprostøedkovanou zkušenost, aby autonomním vozidlùm zaèali vìøit.

titleEN: Velké jazykové modely (LLM): Zhodnocení kvality generovaného textu pomocí dat specifickıch pro danou úlohu
titleCZ: Large Language Models (LLMs): Examining the quality of generated text with task specific data
KeywordsEN: prompt engineering; prompt inenırství; LLM; kontextová data; AI; Generativní AI; vyhodnocování modelu; evaluace modelu; generování textu
KeywordsCZ: AI; context data; Generative AI; model evaluation; text generation; LLM; prompt engineering
AbstractEN: Velké jazykové modely (LLM) se etablovaly jako vıkonné nástroje pro generování textù podobajících se lidské øeèi v rùznıch aplikacích. Tato práce zkoumá faktory ovlivòující úspìch LLM pøi úlohách generování textu, s dùrazem na techniky psaní úvodních pokynù (promptù) a integraci externích dat do tìchto pokynù. Vızkum si klade za cíl ovìøit roli systematické tvorby pokynù, známé jako Prompt Engineering, pøi generování poutavého obsahu, zejména v kontextu psaní marketingovıch newsletterù. Práce zaèíná úvodem do oblasti vızkumu LLM a psaní úvodních pokynù, následovanım literárním pøehledem relevantních technik tvorby pokynù. Na základì tìchto poznatkù je formulována sada hypotéz, které popisují potenciální dopad tìchto technik na kvalitu generovaného textu. K ovìøení hypotéz je proveden kontrolovanı experiment, pøi kterém se identifikované techniky psaní pokynù aplikují na úlohu psaní e-mailovıch newsletterù pomocí jednoho zvoleného velkého jazykového modelu (GPT-3.5-turbo-1106). Generované newslettery jsou hodnoceny pomocí kvantitativních metrik a A/B/n testu emailové kampanì provedené na vzorku (n = 550) registrovanıch úèastníkù univerzitní akce. Vısledky experimentu potvrdily vıznamnou roli technik psaní pokynù a externích dat. Konkrétnì pøi psaní email newsletterù vedlo pouití pokroèilıch technik psaní pokynù ke 15% zlepšení míry prokliku pro konkrétní techniku vyuívající externí data (zlepšení míry prokliku ze 4 % na 19 %). To dokládá, e tvorba pokynù a externí data hrají dùleitou roli pøi vytváøení efektivních textù, které zaujmou ètenáøe. Techniky vyuívající specifikaci tónu hlasu, poskytování dodateènıch kontextovıch dat, relevantních pøíkladù nebo pokynù osvìdèenıch v oboru prokázaly nejvìtší vliv na vıslednı text a dosáhly lepších vısledkù pøi mìøeném úkolu ve srovnání se základním øešením bez pokroèilıch technik psaní pokynù.
AbstractCZ: Large Language Models (LLMs) have emerged as powerful tools for generating human-like text across various applications. This thesis examines the factors influencing the success of LLMs in text generation tasks, focusing on prompting techniques and the integration of external data within the prompt. The research aims to validate the role of prompt engineering in generating compelling content, particularly in the context of writing marketing newsletters. The thesis begins by introducing the research area of LLMs and prompting, followed by a literary review of relevant prompt engineering techniques. Based on the findings, a set of hypotheses is formulated, outlining the potential impact of these techniques on text generation quality. A controlled experiment is conducted to validate the hypotheses, applying the identified prompting techniques to the task of writing email newsletters with a single LLM (GPT-3.5-turbo-1106). The generated newsletters are evaluated using quantitative metrics and A/B/n test campaign to an audience (n=550) of registered attendees of a university event. The results of the experiment confirmed the important role of prompting techniques and external data. On the specific task of newsletter writing, usage of advanced prompting techniques resulted in 15% improvement in click-through rate for a given prompting technique leveraging external data (Improving the click-through rate from 4% to 19%), demonstrating prompt engineering and external data play an important role when creating effective texts that engage the audience. Techniques leveraging specification of tone of voice, providing additional context data, relevant examples or industry best practice instructions have shown to have the largest impact on the resulting text and achieved superior performance on the measured task compared to a base prompt solution without prompting techniques.

titleEN: The potential of using generative artificial intelligence to improve project management workflow
titleCZ: Monosti vyuitia generatívnej umelej inteligencie pre zlepšenie workflow projektového manamentu
KeywordsEN: generative artificial intelligence; Redmine; project management; automation; implementation of artificial intelligence
KeywordsCZ: generatívna umelá inteligencia; projektovı manament; Redmine; automatizácia; implementácia umelej inteligencie
AbstractEN: This bachelor thesis addresses the integration of generative artificial intelligence into a project management workflow using Redmine. The main objectives of the thesis were to demonstrate the practical benefits of the implementation of generative artificial intelligence in project management workflow and to compare selected generative artificial intelligence models in selected processes. The theoretical part of the thesis reviewed the current state of the project management and described the development and practical applications of generative AI, covering existing implementations of this technology for workflow improvement. The practical part of the thesis focuses on the design and testing of a Redmine plugin, analysing and evaluating its functionalities in order to evaluate its effectiveness and impact on workflow. The results of the work suggest that the integration of generative artificial intelligence can significantly increase the efficiency of project management through task automation. The thesis also highlights further opportunities for research into the use of artificial intelligence in project management.
AbstractCZ: Táto bakalárska práca sa zaoberá integráciou generatívnej umelej inteligencie do workflow projektového manamentu pomocou aplikácie Redmine. Teoretická èas práce sa venovala preh¾adu súèasného stavu projektového manamentu a popísala vıvoj a praktické aplikácie generatívnej umelej inteligencie, prièom zahrnula aj existujúce implementácie tejto technológie pre zlepšenie workflow. Práca tie poukazuje na ïalšie monosti vıskumu vyuitia umelej inteligencie v riadení projektov.

AbstractEN: Tato bakaláøská práce se zamìøuje na problematiku optimalizace a zlepšení procesu testování ve spoleènosti Twisto. Cílem je dosáhnout efektivnìjších a spolehlivìjších testovacích postupù. Na základì této analızy jsou navreny a realizovány konkrétní zmìny, které mají zvıšit efektivitu a kvalitu procesu testování. Vızkum se zamìøuje na identifikaci nedostatkù ve stávajících testovacích procesech, analyzuje jejich pøíèiny spolu s jejich vıskytem a navrhuje inovativní øešení k jejich odstranìní. AbstractCZ: Táto bakalárska práca sa zameriava na problematiku optimalizácie a zlepšenia procesu testovania v spoloènosti Twisto. Snahou je dosiahnu efektívnejšie a spo¾ahlivejšie testovacie postupy. titleEN: Reservation system for entrepreneurs and service providers
titleCZ: Rezervaèní systém pro podnikatele a poskytovatele slueb
KeywordsEN: reservation system; online reservation; web application; small businesses; HTML/CSS; Bulma.io; jQuery; PHP
KeywordsCZ: rezervaèní systém; online rezervace; webová aplikace; malí podnikatelé; HTML/CSS; Bulma.io; jQuery; PHP
AbstractEN: Reservation systems are increasingly becoming a vital part of the common services we use in our everyday lives. This thesis addresses the issue of underutilization of reservation systems in the market of small businesses and service providers. Initially, a review of the most well-known reservation systems currently on the market is conducted. This review helps to identify the basic functionalities of reservation systems and highlights potential main obstacles for ordinary small businesses and service providers. This is followed by a survey of selected service provider segments, aimed at verifying the obstacles in using reservation systems and gathering insights on what they believe an ideal solution should look like. Based on the findings from the review and especially the survey, a design for a new reservation system is proposed, which, with the use of additional services, would be a suitable solution for these providers. The proposal is presented in the form of user stories and use case diagrams, and the basic structure of the system with all its key components is graphically illustrated. In the next phase, the reservation system is implemented and tested as a web application using selected technologies. This is followed by an analysis of legislative requirements that will affect the operation of the web application. Subsequently, the collaboration with clients and the implementation of the infrastructure are outlined. In conclusion, the reservation system is subjected to a marketing analysis, and an economic estimate for the first year of operation is presented, which should enable the gradual commercialization of the developed product.
AbstractCZ: Rezervaèní systémy budou stále více dùleitou souèástí bìnıch slueb, které vyuíváme v našem kadodenním ivotì. Následuje vlastní prùzkum vybranıch segmentù poskytovatelù, jeho cílem je ovìøení pøekáek ve vyuívání rezervaèních systémù a shromaïování poznatkù, jak by podle nich mìlo ideální øešení vypadat. Na základì získanıch poznatkù z rešerše a pøedevším prùzkumu je pøedstaven návrh vlastního rezervaèního systému, kterı s vyuitím doplòujících slueb bude pro tyto poskytovatele vhodnım øešením. Návrh je prezentován formou user stories a use case diagramù, dále je graficky znázornìna základní struktura systému se všemi svımi dùleitımi souèástmi. V další fázi je rezervaèní systém v podobì webové aplikace pøi vyuití vybranıch technologií implementován a otestován. Navazuje analıza legislativních poadavkù, které ovlivní provoz webové aplikace. Posléze je pøedstaveno, jak bude vedena spolupráce s klienty a jak bude realizována infrastruktura. titleEN: Artificial Intelligence in Software Testing - A Practical Case Study
titleCZ: Umìlá inteligence v testování softwaru - praktická pøípadová studie
KeywordsEN: testovací pøípad; umìlá inteligence; Testim.io; testování
KeywordsCZ: Testim.io; testovací pøípad; testování; umìlá inteligence
AbstractEN: In today&apos;s fast-paced world of software development, testing plays a key role. Traditional approaches to testing are becoming more and more challenging and time-consuming as applications become more complex. The present work seeks to show how AI can simplify the testing process. The aim of this bachelor thesis is to integrate AI into the process of test case design and automation within a single project, and to perform a subsequent evaluation of the effectiveness of this integration. The thesis is divided into five chapters. The first chapter provides an introduction to the field of artificial intelligence and chatbots, describing the basic principles of their operation. The second chapter focuses on the issue of software testing and its key principles. The third chapter contains a detailed description of the Alza.cz application and the structure of its web interface. The fourth chapter deals with the formulation of test cases using artificial intelligence technologies for the application. The fifth chapter completes the test cases and automates them using the Testim.IO tool. Subsequently, an evaluation of the stability of the tests over a period of time is performed.
AbstractCZ: V dnešním dynamicky se rozvíjejícím svìtì softwarového vıvoje hraje klíèovou roli testování. Tradièní pøístupy k testování se stávají èím dál tím nároènìjšími a èasovì zdlouhavìjšími s rostoucí komplexností aplikací. Daná práce se snaí ukázat, jak AI mùe proces testování zjednodušit. Cílem této bakaláøské práce je v rámci jednoho projektu integrovat umìlou inteligenci do procesu návrhu testovacích pøípadù a jejich automatizace, a provést následné hodnocení efektivity této integrace. Práce je rozèlenìna do pìti kapitol. V první kapitole je uveden úvod do oblasti umìlé inteligence a chatbotù, kde jsou popsány základní principy jejich fungování.
